Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: alixabet
Reviews.Content: Great rasbarry martini made by Mark D was amazing he knew exactly what to make when i was unsure of what drink i wanted and was ever attentive

Reviews.Title: “I'll b back!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffery L
Reviews.Content: Great customer service! Very clean and in Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian d
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, great staff at front desk, very helpful, Food service staff at conference was very nice and food was good as well. Associate Ms. tesgagabr from housekeeping provided great service, room was very clean. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheered up the end to a bad cruise”
Reviews.Author: Derek W
Reviews.Content: A three day post cruise stay at the Westin, was the perfect pick-me-up for the experiences of the Celebrity Century, friendly eager and helpful staff, great for giving tourist advice and assisted with a late check out at 3.00pm when our flight home was at 8.05pm. Great rooms, fast lift, Rooms serviced without fuss, free wi-fi in the foyer a welcome bonus after being out of Scotland for so long. Many Thanks Weir's

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Candi P
Reviews.Content: Everything was really great. Staff was very polite and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kstach
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Diego was a wonderful experience top to bottom. We stayed 4/9-4/11 and we loved it. The staff was exceptional! A little tip for anybody in the service industry: Customer service trumps everything. You can have a great product, but if your customer service is poor, no one cares. Westin San Diego's staff went out of their way to ensure my family and I were satisfied. From Thi Nguyen to Melissa at the bar, to all the guys at the shuttle/transport desk (one of which grabbed me a fresh coffee after my coffee crashed to the floor), this Westin is top notch service. Thanks Westin team. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo H
Reviews.Content: first time I travel to San Diego and had never stayed at Westin hotels, my experience was very pleasant, beautiful view from my room and the quality of cleanliness was excellent. the staff was always friendly especially the maids. Thank you very much Ivan Aragon (Housekeeping Manager) for all your hospitality during our stay, will recommend this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShirleeGrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin, San Diego and were pleasantly pleased. The location was excellent, about 3 blocks from the Gaslight Quarters where there are hundreds of restaurants and shopping to choose from. The young lady at the front desk, Jackie Burkett was exceptional. We wanted a high floor so that we could get a good view of the bay and Jackie was accommodating to say the least. She asked us our reason for visiting and we told her we were celebrating an important anniversary. The room was lovely, very clean with the most comfortable mattress and bedding. We had an LCD 32" inch tv in the room. The bathroom was a bit small but the double headed shower head made up for that. Every day near the elevator there was a basket of green apples. The elevators were awesome, with the glass all around and being on the outside of the building when you were going up you could see everything on the Bay, especially nice at night. When we arrived we left our suitcases in the room and went out to scout the area. When we came back there was a beautiful strawberry plater, gift and card to congratulate us on our special anniversary. So thoughtful and unexpected. I would not suggest using the self parking for $24.00 but instead use the Valet for $32.00. Everytime you go in and out of the parking they charge you by 15 min increments, so if you plan to go in and out often better to just go with the valet parking. I asked for an Irish coffee at the hotel bar late in the evening and they didn't have coffee, but went over to the restaurant and got me coffee and made me my drink. Went over and above. The hotel restaurant is a bit pricey but with all the restaurants in close proximity that is not even an issue. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in beautiful San Diego”
Reviews.Author: VacationTraveller101
Reviews.Content: After walking a couple of short blocks from the train station, we were greeted by a very nice front desk clerk and a truly wonderful Hotel Manager. The check-in experience was easy and quick, and the lobby was gorgeous, with fruit infused cold water and very comfortable seating. The rooms were clean and spacious, with very comfortable beds. The exericse room was large, immaculate, and very accessible. The concierge and bellmen were very helpful, and the Hotel Manager, Luke, went out of his way to ensure that our stay was truly memorable. We really enjoyed this hotel, and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice in place in San Diego Downtown”
Reviews.Author: nellipuzha
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel located in downtown San Diego and within walking distance of the pier and other attractions. We were upgraded to a Suite which turned out to be a nice two room, two bath affair. The view of the downtown from our 27th floor window was awesome. It would have been great if there was a door opening into the balcony. The breakfast at this place is average at best. There is a fair amount of cooked and health stuff. But then, I have seen better spreads.

Reviews.Title: “Hung up in my face”
Reviews.Author: Jen B
Reviews.Content: Wow. All I did was call to ask how much the parking fee was for overnight, and the woman kept saying "Can I have your name?" "Which room would you like?" She was so desperate to get my information that she FLAT OUT REFUSED to answer my question. When I finally said "Can I just find out how much parking is?" She said "Okay, bye bye." AND HUNG UP ON ME. I would never stay at a place so rude! So glad I didn't make a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Stay”
Reviews.Author: Audrey B
Reviews.Content: I am running workshops at the Westin San Diego, and the staff has been great. They know our schedule very well and have taken time to understand exactly what we need. Manuel, Alfredo Lopez, and Jose Herrera have been great at refreshing the room when necessary and setting it up for the next day. They have been very helpful throughout the entire program, even handling a few clean ups that are not in their job description. The banquets team has also been fantastic, and I would recommend this venue for any business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but extremely rude check in experience”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: I was able to take a rare weekend down to celebrate my best friends fiancée birthday. We were only spending one day down in San deigo so we were ready to have a great time. I was initially impressed with the look of the hotel. I walked up to check in and was treated by an extremely rude person at the front desk. I asked a few simple questions about the hotel and the charges to my card and every response was short and made me feel like they were stupid questions. I wasn't going to let her ruin my day because it seems like she was a in happy person. We ending up having a good stay but would think twice about going back. For me the people I interact with are as I portent as the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay - in spite of the spider bites!”
Reviews.Author: Bob C
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Westin San Diego recently, I was bitten on the ankle by a spider that had evidently gotten caught up in my bedclothes somehow. The staff was very solicitous and checked to make sure that it was not bedbugs or anything else that I had to worry about taking home with me. There were no new bites the second night and, though the bites looked pretty spectacular initially, they faded quickly once I took some antihistamines. The room was very nice and the staff attention to detail was admirable. The way they responded to the incident is a testament, I think, to how rare such an event must be. They made my stay quite pleasant otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: Leah B
Reviews.Content: Really liked this place. Always wanted to stay a a Westin prperty in California.Very clean. Close to many things, Convenient. Staff very nice. Would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: ChemSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business as I was in town for a conference. Loved this hotel! Spacious, clean room & bathroom, nice shower, plenty of counter space in the bathroom. Bed was super-comfortable, liked the work desk with ample, accessible plug ins. The HVAC system in the room is very quiet. The hotel in general was extremely quiet during my three-night stay. Used the complimentary airport shuttle both coming and going and it was perfect. Didn't try any of the restaurants on the property as I wanted to explore the Gaslamp Quarter for dining. All the staff I encountered were courteous, helpful, and very friendly. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Stuart M
Reviews.Content: As part of a two week trip we spent two nights at the westin San Diego. The hotel is ideally located, near to the trolley,and many of the San Diego attractions. On arrival at the airport we called for the shuttle which arrived promptly. The driver was friendly and engaging and pointed out the local amenities in the vacinity of the hotel. Our check in was smooth and friendly, and we were helped to our room on an SPG floor promptly and efficiently. The room was spacious, airy and very clean with all the amenities you would expect from a Westin. We had a bay view which was great. We visited the bar for dinner and drinks and were greeted by a very friendly waitress who couldn't do enough to help us. We had cocktails and appetizers - both were fantastic! This is a great value hotel where friendly staff offer a level of service that exceeds expectations.

Reviews.Title: “My Birthday.”
Reviews.Author: EmmieLuVay
Reviews.Content: I stayed in SD for my bday so I stayed at the Westin Hotel. It was great even tho they have many parking options none of them are really affortable options. Valet parking is $32 a nite. Not really cool. They charge $8 extra just for room service the good was good but a bit over priced I paid $51 just to salmon & lemon sorbet.The valet guys were really professional & nice. My room (kings deluxe/w bay view) was pretty cool nice & neat beds are really heavenly as the hotel promotes it.. All in all I would stay gets again bit would eat else where.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good area but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Buckshee
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, nice rooms and located in a very central area of San Diego. On the plus side it's a Westin, rooms of the normal 4 star standard, staff helpful when required and most things are as they should be in a hotel of this status. Location is excellent and the Trolley is just steps away as is fifth avenue and the Bay Area. On the minus, pool was closed for over 3 months for renovation and we only found out by accident through trip advisor a few days before we arrived. (we booked hotel 8 months in advance). We received written confirmation from travel agent that the Westin had Not informed them of pool closure and the Westin confirmed this and belatedly apologised for any inconvenience and said the pool of thei sister hotel 4 blocks away was Available (not my idea of fun having to drag my 4 year old a few blocks for a bit of fun in a pool when I Believed I booked and paid for a hotel with a Perfectly functioning pool) !!! So an apology after the event and nothing more not even a complimentary day or two of wi-fi or breakfast ??? Couple of Patchy days also in relation to the daily replacement of amenities such as Tea, shampoo etc where they appear to have been completely forgotten. Wouldn't lose sleep over this but still mildly annoying in a hotel of this standard and price. Overall a decent hotel in a central location but still taking a lot or granted

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: karenedmonds
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business. One company I do business with recently relocated 1 block from the San Diego Westin and this was my first stay there. I stay at a lot of hotels and I really liked the Westin. It was super clean, the bed was extremely comfortable, they have decorated it very nicely, my room was quiet, the shower was great with two shower heads, the hotel is well laid out. Overall I was impressed. I would rate this hotel better then the other hotels I stay at for business. I had a good experience and thought customer service was great, starting from my first call to make reservations. I also called the hotel directly and Leon Williams at the front desk was fabulous. He promised to get me some answers and he did exactly what he promised, and called me back promptly. His customer service was excellent. I was impressed with this hotel enough to write this review, I have never written one before.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Jas H
Reviews.Content: First time overnight in downtown San Diego. Booked online then called ahead before leaving Orange County by car. The hotel had not received our reservations yet, but Leon took everything down, arranged the room to our specifications, and wished us a safe trip. We stopped off in Old Town for dinner, advised the hotel, and Leon told us to take our time and wished us a good time. Arriving late at night, the staff took care of our every need. We were made to feel at home, our room and luggage set up to our preference and our every need tended to. We were shown a map and how to get to our next day's destinations and where to dine. The Hotel is modern, spacious, and beautiful. The surrounding skyline is spectacular. 4 star hotels I've stayed in on the east coast are more expensive and not nearly as nice. Leon and his staff made our stay comfortable and a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Westin knows how to pick good staff.”
Reviews.Author: AaronsTripTips
Reviews.Content: I was having trouble printing to the guest computer. Leon W at the front desk offered to print it for me, which saved me a lot of time and frustration. He also gave some good suggestions for restaurants. Thanks, Leon!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Less than it could be”
Reviews.Author: skingirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for one week for business. While the room was clean, the bed comfortable and the service good, I have a few issues with the Westin. I find it incredibly annoying to be charged for internet service at a nice hotel. I recently stayed at a Holiday Inn Express and the bed was more comfortable, the internet was free and I got a gift on my arrival. That creates a feeling of brand loyalty for me. I thought I could go to the business center to catch up on my email but found that the computers there also carry a usage and per minute charge. If you print anything, you are also charged for paper (even for the two pieces of paper for my boarding pass). What is more is I was sent an email asking me if I wanted a "bay view" room for $20 a night more. I decided to go ahead and splurge. I am posting the picture and you can decide if it is worth the extra money. They also tell you that you will get two free bottles of water a day and then only leave one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: jesathome
Reviews.Content: Was at this hotel for a week--part vacation and part conference. Nice location to walk around and see the city and sights. 2 days our room did not get cleaned--the excuse was that they were "real busy" with a lot of guests checking out and checking in. Concierge was not helpful and was not able to answer questions. Room was ok and view from 19th floor was excellent. The price for wi-fi is ridiculous. $40 for the week and only good in your room--couldn't use it in conference area. Ate at the restaurant a few times but only had limited menu that never changed and very pricey!! Take the Old Town Trolley tour so you know what you want to see!

Reviews.Title: “Best Waitor”
Reviews.Author: lauren v
Reviews.Content: We ate in the hotel restaurant a few times. We had the nicest, most awesome Waitor EVER! His name was Nathan Nichols and it was only because of him that we paid the way too expensive prices to eat there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MaRoche
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for a Conference on March 14th for 4 days. The room was clean, comfortable and the service was exceptional. I loved the dual shower head!! We visted the Concierge a few times and she was very helpful. She provided us with a free appetizer coupon for a mexican restaurant in Old Town and discount tickets were avaialble for the U.S.S. Midway. They even lent us an umbrella for the day! On St. Patrick's Day they had an assortment of green candy downstairs. That was so much fun! We were disappointed that the pool was not working; however the weather was chilly so it ended up being okay. Thank you for a great stay Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BSCMDA
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Very centric, Is located in the heart of downtown. As a member of SPG, we accumulate points. The bed Is Very comfortable, it has toiletry that Is not the generic soaps on the rest of hotels. The train station Is just one block away. If you rent a car beware! The parking Is 32$ per day! There Is no cheaper option to Park around . We used the train transportation since Is quite reliable on time schedules. The Rooms are spacious, once you reserve they will ask you to upgrade for a Bay view, I knew better and did not upgraded, but yet still got the bay view. The Orange line Is just two stop far from seaport village, where there are few selection of restaurants and shops, this Is a must see. The blue line goes to old town, another place to see, which has a big selection of mexican restaurants. Overall Is a great service, no complaints. Rooms are very clean with a fresh smell, yet the best Is that is smoke free hotel. For the smokers would not be their First choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: clickonline
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were very average compared to other Westin hotels that I have stayed at. The room decor is very stale. The location is a little bit away from the all the action of the Gaslamp district. Rates are also pricier than other Starwood properties in the region. If you are in San Diego, I will recommend staying at the Westin Gaslamp for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl77
Reviews.Content: If you are taking the train into downtown San Diego, this hotel is in a great location. We stayed there overnight, as far as hotels go it was average. The front desk staff was friendly. The room was standard size and could probably use a little updating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, TERRIBLE Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Starwood Member, and spent 3 nights at this hotel. The room was pretty small and the Front Desk staff was inconsiderate and pretty much lacked interest in my dissatisfaction with their service. Also upon checking out, they refused to cash a travelers check even though I was a top tier member, had spent three nights at the hotel and used a Platinum credit card to settle my bill. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.... wonderful parking valets.”
Reviews.Author: SarsfieldC
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently spent 5 nights at the Westin San Diego for her 16th birthday. Very friendly staff; especially the parking valets. They are always there to help us with directions and suggestions of places to visit. Parking was expensive however, it seems to be the going rate for the downtown hotels. Beds were amazing! After a long day out hitting the pavement siteseeing, the beds were so comfortable, sleep came easy. Only disappointment my daughter mentioned was the fact that the pool was closed. The staff did offer us the option to use the pool at their other hotel but, we didn't want to leave once we were in for the night. Front desk staff was very friendly and willing to help us with any of our needs. I had trouble printing out our boarding passes for the return trip home, evening desk person went out of his way to help me get all in order. A big thank you to everyone for a wonderful stay. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Zuleana Cano is the BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: T F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Westin for Business. Zuleana was my saver!! She was always helpful and always smiling. This helped being the reason I was there was not a good one. I waas away from home and family and she made my stay at the Westin a Great one. She went out of her way to make sure my stay was pleasant. Once you get past the RUDE front desk staff (not all) but enough. The rest of the staff there are all special. Thank you to all i wish I had everyones name to mention. NATE, MARK, CYNTHIA, DANIEL, the VALET GUYS, THE LADIES at the Starbucks counter the Restaurant staff!! THANK YOU!!!! The prices were out of control, but all the right people to make it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good property, great staff”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelIsTheBest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a couple days at the Westin San Diego - I had been in town on business, so we decided to stay the weekend. The hotel is nice, in a great location, very well run, and while getting a little older still very comfortable. We definitely want to make special mention of one of the bell staff, Berlon Sioson, who was most helpful with our luggage when my wife checked in, made sure we had everything we needed in the room, helped us with directions, and was just exceptionally pleasant. Berlon is an asset to the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Unassuming”
Reviews.Author: AJ H
Reviews.Content: Nothing real bad to say about this hotel, but nothing spectacular either. It's a nice, unassuming hotel. An average Westin. I would stay again if the price was right. By far, the best feature is the location (or perhaps all the friendly Packer fans staying there the weekend we were there). Pool area is below average and the pictures on the hotel website make it better than it appears. Serivce was good, however there was a mix-up with my billing and I was charged an additional fee three weeks later without my knowledge. Overall, a nice place to stay as long as you are not expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: “High marks!”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: Just have to let you know how much I enjoyed staying at the Westin in San Diego. Your staff was great - so helpful and courteous at every turn. I especially appreciated the (lady) manager of the restaurant who, despite my showing up at closing time, was so accommodating. The room was spacious and immaculate - towels always fresh and the rest of the room clean. Many thanks. I look forward to staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pool was closed...we even asked about it at rsvp”
Reviews.Author: lisainla
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff and manage were rude and didn't care that we expected a heated pool. It was closed for renovation. We carried our down luggage cart. Buffet buffer items were not refilled in a timely manner. Waited 20 min for more pancakes. Overall disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Not good for travelers who need to eat after hours”
Reviews.Author: QualMod
Reviews.Content: This review focuses on 'after hours' room service/food options (which is important to me as I work nights when I travel and have no chance to eat dinner). I choose my hotels based on this. The Westin San Diego's web site stated that they offer after-hours room service. They do offer a bit of food. But the "menu" is VERY limited and food is pre-made earlier in the day (see photo of menu): Cereal, fruit, 2 sandwiches (ham & swiss $12), baby greens or Caesar salad (w/chicken $18), lasagna ($18), ice cream. That's it. Also, San Diego does not allow wine to be delivered to your room after 11pm (what!?). The Westin San Diego's bar closes at 11pm BUT their web site says 12:00pm close time. Will need to stay at another hotel next San Diego trip. Additional: rooms nice/basic/clean. Staff friendly and professional. Great location. They went to the wrong room and did not deliver my salad (mid-night) - but comped it due to this. Nice gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Restaurant Service”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: We would like to particularly credit two individuals who provided us outstanding customer service while we ate breakfast Sunday morning in the hotel restaurant--Marites Sobreo and Juan Verduzco. They are both great ambassadors for the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Juan Verduzco”
Reviews.Author: Susanne B
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of dining in the restaurant every morning during our stay. Juan was personable and gracious with us. He gave us great attention and advise as to where to visit and what to do. We truly had a grand experience during our breakfast our in the restaurant and with Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: 2Flysouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for our wedding anniversary first weekend in February. What a great choice of hotel. Very convenient location and the rooms are great. This hotel has incredible staff, we did not meet a single person who was not friendly and helpful. A very special thank you to Melissa and Kayti for making our stay so memorable. Melissa you are a great ambassador for the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: NicknAZ49
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel downtown in San Diego that is conveniently located and offers clean, comfortable accommodations, the Westin is the place, Our room had all the creature comforts you expect at a Westin, along with a wonderful staff that was most helpful in getting around. The Westin is only a block away from the light rail which takes you anywhere you want to go on an all day pass of only $5.00 per day. The pass allows you to take not only light rail but buses and trolley, as well. It is as easy to go to Gaslamp Quarter or Balboa Park from here, so next time you want to visit San Diego, the Westin is a great option. Concierge services are top notch and will provide directions, suggestions and make reservations. The Front desk staff was very helpful when we asked for assistance or a minor repair. We would definitely stay at this property again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & great service”
Reviews.Author: VinoLibra
Reviews.Content: Walking distance or quick cab to all the action, excellent, courteous service and laid back bar scene. Only negative would be the pool was out of commission.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby Bar!”
Reviews.Author: lst_2012
Reviews.Content: I was having a dreary trip, but the bartender Mark was so much fun! And, he mixed great drinks. We had a lot of fun watching "The Voice" after the Super Bowl. Also, there was another bartender, a woman (I can't recall her name) she is a real pro and gave some great tips on visiting Coronado Island. Thanks so much to both of you!

Reviews.Title: “Least pleasant westin”
Reviews.Author: Jkwusa
Reviews.Content: Westin is among my favorite hotel chains, so I was very surprised by the indifferent treatment I rec'd from the front desk and concierge staff at this property. Colleagues staying at the same hotel had a similar experience. When I called for a blow dryer it never showed up. OK, mistakes happen. So I called again and was assured it was on the way. Nope. After a third call, I had to leave so mentioned at the front desk and then it arrived after another 2 hours wait. I'm frankly baffled. For clarity, maids and bellhops were quite helpful, but I couldn't buy a smile or polite/helpful word from the concierge and had the same problem several times with some (but not all) of the front desk staff. They did appear to be having a good time talking amongst themselves, however. The room was fine and clean but again I had to call when they forgot to clean it on a given day.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were cold and programed with canned responses”
Reviews.Author: Delisa J
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently and know good service when I get it. I stayed at the Westin the first week in February, 2012. The place was clean and relatively comfortable. However, the staff left a bad taste in my mouth. Each time I had a concern they listened long enough to give me a canned response, rarely answering the question that I posed. The pool was out of commission and appears to have been so for a long while. When we asked about it, we were told that we could go to their sister hotel the W down the street. My boyfriend went there and said it was next to the YMCA and that was the pool they referred us too. When I asked about a room change that didn't overlook construction; I was told there would be a 20.00 upgrade fee. We went through the hassel to change rooms only to find that the view was worst than the original. Most of the staff just seemed disinterested in true customer service. They would smile nod and ask how they could help, but would only give the necessary answer for you to go away. There was one bright spot, the consierge desk, Thi was pleasant and offered advise on restaurants. I wouldn't stay here again. You get the basics but then its every woman and man for themself.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Quiet!”
Reviews.Author: briandti
Reviews.Content: Our 2-day stay was lovely. The room was very quiet and even had a well-engineered heavy-duty metal vent of that could be flipped to allow fresh air in through a narrow slot but then closed to exclude the noise of the city down below. The bed was extremely comfortable and everything from the glass elevators (there were also enclosed elevators for those who are afraid of heights) to the bar were elegant and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Gordondd9
Reviews.Content: Solid Westin property in downtown San Diego. part of office complex but all functions fine. Good value if not much atmosphere but serves purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room,Staff,Chicken wings and more”
Reviews.Author: Bob E
Reviews.Content: 4 Night stay here was great. Each day room was cleaned perfectly. This room service staff pays attention to your door hanger. The Staff at the desk bar and restaurant were also great. Breakfast buffet was good and well stocked. Buffet host even did the little free smoothy thing. Bed, sheets and towels, all quality you would expect of a fine hotel. Evening room service food was very good. Few get a steak correct when ordered medium-well. This Westin did. Handy fridge in the room to put a few healthy snacks that I picked up at Ralph's, just a few blocks away. I prefer an empty fridge over one full of calories. Finally, the room thermostat works perfectly. I will stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, food & staff!”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: I just came back from 5 days of business travel in San Diego ... I know, it's a tough life! Our meetings were being held in a location away from downtown, so the owner of our company suggested we do some pricing and scope out our downtown options. The Westin San Diego was offering a far better rate than the other options in the same range. It was great being close enough to walk to the waterfront and the Gaslamp district to check out a few of the scads of awesome restaurants where we had some amazing meals! We did also eat in the hotel often enough, so I got to know the a couple of the bartenders at the hotel bar. Particularly Mark D: a friendly, approachable bartender with a wealth of knowledge of everything on the menu as well as San Diego in general. A co-worker and I came down for a late lunch during a break and wanted to sample a few things from the menu that Mark had described in colorful detail. The spicy fish tacos, California club & calamari were all amazing! He also let us customize our meals so that we were able to try more than we would have otherwise. We really appreciated the flexibility he offered us. Later, when I was looking for something refreshing to drink, he suggested his one of his concoctions, what he called a Michilada: beer of your choice (I went with Modelo), lime and some tangy seasoning around the rim. It hit the spot! And so did all the food. I told him I wanted to take him with me to make all my food decisions with me on a daily basis! Even if you don’t want to stay in the hotel to eat, he is familiar with a lot of the restaurants in the area, both high and low end, for those wanting to venture out. (And while the food in the hotel is fantastic, I don’t know why you wouldn’t. San Diego is chuck fill of amazing restaurants!)

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: knsthompson
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to everything. Great home base to explore San Diego. Business oriented but only a few blocks from the water, gas lamp, and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Staff needs training.”
Reviews.Author: dontSeattle
Reviews.Content: It's very disappointing to go to a 4+ star hotel and receive less than the best treatment. When we got to this hotel, we were immediately asked for our car keys by the valet (the only parking offered by the hotel). We told the valet we would be right back after checking in to get our luggage. However, after checking in our car was nowhere to be seen. Later we went to the concierge desk to book tickets to the zoo. No one was there. The reception staff told us to wait and the concierge would be back shortly. After waiting 10 minutes, the reception asked us what we wanted and when told we wanted to book tickets they informed us the concierge would not be back for another 15 minutes. The room was comfortable but the bed was no better than the La Quinta or Comfort Inns we've also stayed at on this trip. and parking was an unreasonable $32 per day. I don't understand why. It it seems consistent that the more you pay for a room the more you are expected to pay for amenities and services like parking and internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_0912
Reviews.Content: It was a week before my arrival and I wanted to extend my stay one more day because of a scheduled customer meeting and I was told that it could be done but my rate would jump up over $100 more and that I had to take it or leave it. I went out online and found a cheaper rate at the same hotel. I did not want to give up so I called the hotel direct and asked for a "onsite Reservations Manager and I was transfered to her and of course had to leave a message (this was on a Tuesday) and I never heard back until I wrote an e-mail to the General Manager. It was late Friday afternoon when the Reservations Manager finally got back to me and stated that she was horrible at checking her messages, but I had to make other arrangenments to stay at another hotel and was NOT a Westin property.

Reviews.Title: “Jose Antonio Selvas at The Restaurant Provided GREAT Service!”
Reviews.Author: M G
Reviews.Content: Jose Antonio Selvas at The Restaurant Provided GREAT Service! He was very nice and patient. There was a problem with my order and he was very nice about changing it.

Reviews.Title: “Uncharacteristic”
Reviews.Author: Donald c
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Westin San Diego, was pleasant enough until about 5AM when construction across the street on a High Rise Office Building, interrupted my sleep every morning during my stay. What was upsetting about the situation was, that I had upgraded my reservation in order to have a view of the bay. I felt the Westin should have informed me of the construction outside my window. If your Driving be aware that it will cost you $32.00 a day to park at the Westin. On checking out I asked if they gave a discount for handicap parking, well they don't. I will finish by saying everything else was impeccable. Well almost, I had called for help with my luggage when ready to leave, after waiting 20 min. I gave up and struggled to the lobby with my luggage. Would I stay at a Westin again, absolutely. Would I stay at the Westin San Diego most certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Credit for the concierge”
Reviews.Author: Edna K
Reviews.Content: On new year's eve BA flight to London was cancelled due to fog. We stayed the night and most of next day in the WESTIN. I wish to give credit to THI NGUYEN, the concierge who handled us, a group of stranded passengers, for the whole time there, with patience and grace And did not leave us with unanswered questions. She really did a very good job !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: terrijmc
Reviews.Content: My huband and I stayed here for three nights. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Luke, the front desk manager, insured we had a wonderful stay. We had the breakfast buffet each morning and were always remembered and seated at our favorite table. The hotel was clean and nicely decorated. The valet parking was pricey. Public transportation is very good. The hotel also offers a complimentary airport shuttle. Next time we won't rent a car. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: dsm22203
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Westin San Diego to attend a conference and received the service and amenities that I have come to expect from Westin. The Heavenly Bed in my room lived up to the experience that I have received at other Westin properties and I enjoyed 2 restful nights. But perhaps where this property excels the most is with the staff; the staff are exceedingly professional and provide commendable guest service. From the complimentary airport shuttle (something not offered by many neighboring hotels) to recommendations for dining and entertainment, the staff are enthusiastic with providing the best experience for guests. That said, I was a bit surprised that my SPG member status was not recognized. I was not given a room on an SPG floor (perhaps that was due to occupancy), nor was I thanked for my Starwood loyalty. Strange. Also, my room was "peculiar" in its small size and layout. Judging by a glimpse at the floor chart posted beside the elevator, my XX12 room was clearly the smallest and most bizarrely shaped on the floor. Oh well...I spent so little time in the room that it didn't matter to me, but I point this out because I wish to caution others that the XX12 rooms are obviously subprime. If returning to San Diego, this property would top my list along with the other Westin down the street, Omni, and Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “THI N. - THE CONCIERGE @The Westin is outstanding !!”
Reviews.Author: Pam F
Reviews.Content: This is a belated thank you to Thi N. (the most gracious, kind, compassionate and patient Concierge at the Westin San Diego on 400 W Broadway) for the way she helped many passengers 'abandoned' by British Airways on New Year's Eve when our flight to London, Heathrow was cancelled due to fog. On New Year's Day Thi (pronounced 'tee' - a lovely young woman) helped me personally by allowing me to stay on the line to British Airways for a very long time (and many other passengers too). Eventually Thi 'saved the day' for all of us by speaking to a supervisor/manager and insisting we be given accurate information and be kept informed (everything was conflicting info before this). Thi was instrumental in the passengers being bussed (around 4 pm) and eventually being taken to LA for a flight the following day to Heathrow - arriving into the UK on January 3rd instead of January 1st! Thi took everyone's names and made sure the list was checked and anyone who'd gone for a walk and hadn't returned to the hotel in time for the bus that eventually arrived (only due to Thi - no BA representative ever appeared) was told how to get themselves to LA. I was very, very lucky to have booked the last leg of my trip with air miles and managed to fly out 24 hours later (after being told there was 'no flight'; then there was a flight 'but no seats available' etc -- all very untrue). I hope the Westin San Diego give high recognition to a wonderful young woman who deserves a platinum medal for her patience and compassion!! And the hotel was lovely too! BA finally got us in there around 12.30 am - but of course we had to get our own transport there (unfortunately the shuttle bus from the hotel stops around 11 pm and it was New Year's Eve too). BA gets zero points for communication - and Thi gets the maximum for effort :)

Reviews.Title: “**Comfort from Home**”
Reviews.Author: TravelinEast
Reviews.Content: Lodged there for a three day conference and had a wonderful experience from front-desk and other staff. The room was magnificent and had a little view of the water, once you overlooked the contruction. After completion though you may still be able to see the water. Nice panoramic wide windows. The bed was great after a long day, so much so, I looked under the bed spread to find out the name brand! Tried a little Parisan style cafe around the corner that offered good food. Amazingly clean city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, especially Mark D at the bar. Enjoyed drinks and appetizers during happy hour. Comfortable room, great beds. Enjoyed dinner at the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alistair78
Reviews.Content: Its what you would expect for a large American hotel. Nice beds, clean rooms. Not in the most beautiful part of the city, but gas lamp is a 10 min walk down the road. I wouldn't use this as a holiday hotel, but when your working it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect, good location”
Reviews.Author: threek
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and had a view to the water and the USS Midway museum. Good location as we could walk to the embarcadero and the gas lamp district with lots of eating choices. Didn't use the internet or restaurants in the hotel so can't comment on that, but the staff we interacted with were always friendly and helpful. The kids wanted to swim after dinner and we were pleased to find the pool water in the 80's in January. We had beautiful weather and were out except to change or coming in for the evening so this place fit the bill for our stay. Will agree with another reviewer about the expensive valet parking on site but there are other options nearby that are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Business District Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baz118
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a typical business district hotel with an interesting architecture based on a hexagonal theme which has become slightly dated. The staff were very helpful and after an intial problem with an additional room booking the matter was quickly rectified. The wireless internet speed was poor. Location was great. Gym and pool deck were ideal for a city centre venue and whiltst the pool deck was worn this is being rectified. The rate did not include breakfast allowing us to explore local venues, the best being cafe 222. Finally, the ferry tip to Coronado with bike hire is recommended (conceige can arrange this for you).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, poor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Behrcat
Reviews.Content: It's located a couple of blocks from the train station and within walking distance of the Gaslamp district, the marina, Little Italy and the fabulous SD trolley and bus service. Good value for what you pay (used Travelzoo to get best rate) and Diane at the front desk was wonderful in suggesting a good restaurant that could accommodate my dietary needs. The hotel restaurant left much to be desired, but her recommendation to go to the Karl Strauss 2 blocks away, even phoning them to confirm turned an otherwise disappointing experience into a memorable one. Thank you Diane. Great service! P.S. The beds are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego xMas Stay”
Reviews.Author: JimOxnard
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in San Diego, and our experience at the hotel was one of the best we've ever had. This experience was due to the great staff. From the bellmen, the concierge, the front desk; to the great maid service. My family really values the people that were there on Dec 19 to Dec 22. Our maid had our room pristine every day and put the finishing touch that no other hotel has ever done for us - she put my son's favorite stuffed animal, his puppy, in the center of the bed by the remote control. That made his day. She always smiled and was very friendly to us every day. The bed and pillows were the best. I always sleep well at a Westin. Thank you so much and see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms, great location, one of the best Westin properties I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: nmd76
Reviews.Content: I got upgraded to a deluxe room because of my Starwood gold status It was a beautiful room, open space, great furniture and clean The lobby was gorgeous, open floor plan, a place I would have actually hung out in if I had time...but couldn't because I needed to rest for work. Room service food was very good and efficient The only thing is there is construction going around the area so it's hard to find parking and you'll have to pay $32 a night if you have a rental

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: MrLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: The main thing that drew me to book my stay at the Westin SD was its location. Pretty much walking distance to everything. The hotel is also very clean and the beds were very comfortable. It wasn't crowded at all so checking in was a breeze....I sometimes even wondered if there were any other guests staying at the hotel?! A couple of things bothered me though. Realizing how close the hotel was to the train depot, I knew there would be a lot of train and trolly noise throughout the day and nights. I had specifically requested a room that was facing away from the tracks, but was given one that was facing the main street (Broadway) so could hear the train horns very clearly at nights. The next day I just decided I wasn't going to bother requesting a room change as I'd already unpacked everything and had settled in. Another issue that bothered me was that I had called the Westin reservations number to enquire about a lower rate I found on their website (where I had originally booked my room a few weeks earlier). The reservations guy told me that I had pre-paid my hotel stay and that that he could try give me the better rate. He couldn't access the system to do anything that evening so suggested he send the hotel a message to assist in making this adjustment upon my check in. At check in I mentioned this to the guy at the reception, but he said he didn't see any message and subsequently summoned another guy, whom I'm assuming may be the manager. He did a little checking and informed me that they never received any message from Westin reservations, and besides, my booking was pre-paid so there was no way it was changeable. This is not what the reservations told me, and I've known of other instances when they would give the best rate possible even though the room was pre-paid. They were polite about this, but didn't seem too friendly, but it was late and I didn't want to bother arguing about it. I would stay here again only if I was sure I'm getting a very quiet room as requested. I wished the hotel would have paid more attention to these little details as it's stated right on there with the reservation, and it definitely makes a difference to the guests to know that the hotel cares.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant, clean, and efficient way to travel.”
Reviews.Author: GQ_82
Reviews.Content: I thought everything was GREAT, EXCEPT for the girl at the front desk when we checked in.... She was NOT helpful at all, had a bit of an attitude, and have an overall aura of either, apathy or superiority. Either one, she was not very pleasant at all. And it was NOT the welcoming two people who just drove a good 3 hours at night (we checked in at 10pm) should have received. I work in customer service and this girl definitely needed some work.... Maybe you can figure out who she was? I can't remember the name tag BUT she was about 5'9", dark hair, pale complexion, and worked the night shift of December 14th, 2011 (my girlfriend's, who was present at the time, birthday). Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View - Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: SNoon4056
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the view from the 20th floor, which was overlooking the bay. (A photo is attached.) The room was comfortable, clean, like you'd expect from a Westin. The closet is a bit small, and like most hotels these days, pre-stocked with too much crap to allow you store much in them (Blanket, pillow, safe, ironing board, iron, luggage jack, etc.) I really appreciated the work desk with numerous outlets, but the chair doesn't go high enough to make the whole scenario functional. I'm typing uphill at the moment. The lobby is very nice with dramatic two story escalators. The service is excellent here. And the food that I've sampled was quite good!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: kristin s
Reviews.Content: I normally always stay at this Westin, and they are absolutely wonderful. This last time I was there they were under construction which was fine, but when I was placed on the Starwood guest floor, I was very dissapointed because when I walked out of my bathroom there was a cut out of my ceiling in the hallway. All I saw was that it was pitch black and that's all I could see. I was so upset and called the front desk. They were short staffed so I was told that I could move rooms, but they had no more Starwood rooms availiable, and that if I wanted someone to bring me a new key I would need to wait about 15 minutes. I said fine, but was very dissapointed in the service let alone the privacy that I felt was violated by the hole in my ceiling. Nobody offered to help me move my belongings as well to the new room either. I was dissapointed to say the least considering normally they are a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “holiday party”
Reviews.Author: golftina
Reviews.Content: this was a great mini stay. The room was so nice and clean and the entire staff was very accommodating. Even with a few disruptions in the hotel (construction from a broken pipe) we were made to feel very comfortable and our Company Holiday party was in a beautiful room food was delicious and service excellent. Molly the concierge was so helpful with helping to deliver items to the banquet room and extremely kind and engaging.!!! you have a great ambassator for your hotel with Molly at the front desk area. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent starwood property!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights before staying at the W which is just steps away. I must say this property is so much better than the W on many levels ( I am normally a big W fan). Staff were very helpful and friendly. I got upgraded to a suite which was huge!! The heavenly bed was to die for. I will stay here over the W when I am back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Mike Stanik-Director of first impressions”
Reviews.Author: Consuela S
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Diego and I was extremely excited. I arrived on December 2, 2011. While awaiting the shuttle to the hotel we basked in the beautiful weather. We were picked up by Mike Stanik the driver. He was a breath of fresh air with his welcoming smile and positive demeanor. I thought to myself that Mike as the director of first impressions was an omen of how the trip was to go. He gave us a bit of history, answered all of our questions and made us feel at home. I was in town for the ACN international training event and am extremely glad that I booked this hotel. The staff was wonderful and made everyone feel as they were the only guest in the hotel. When we arrived there were a lot of people checking in from ACN so it was like a party meeting and greeting old and new friends. The location was right near the trolley line which gave us easy access. On the 4th when I checked out to my delight Mike was again my driver and my director of lasting impressions. Based on my overall impression I booked my room for the Charlotte NC international training at The Westin. I will be back to San Diego and pray the I get Mike again. You need to make Employee of the Month or better yet the year because I am sure that I am not the only one who has sung his praise. If anyone reads this review PLEASE ask for Mike Stanik to be your driver. Awesome gentleman and your Director of first and lasting impressions.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been forewarned”
Reviews.Author: Gerry D
Reviews.Content: On arrival the lobby was a mesh due to whatever, we should have been forewarned and given the option for a further discount or many starwood points. Also it would make sense to use the address of the side street, so a Garmin would direct you to the proper entrance. Also the hotel should make an arrangement, so self parking can be charged to the room and one should still be allowed to drive in and out several times a day. If you want to know how this is possible, talk to your collegue at the Westin in Costa Mesa

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: CrystalSorrows
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night, a Saturday on December 3 2011, and used my airline miles to pay for the room. My room was fine, spacious, nice bathroom comfy bed, I didn't expect a view or anything since I paid with miles. I parked across the street on Columbia for $15 for 24 hours. This works great as long as you don't need in and out privileges. They have happy hour 4 to 6 in the bar, but I didn't get a chance to try it on Saturday. The location is fantastic, about 10-15 minute walk to the gaslamp, Little Italy, or the harbor. The number 7 bus to the park and zoo is about 2 minutes away and the trolley is around the corner. Housekeeping checked in with me about 2 hours after I arrived and asked if I needed anything which was nice. Because of the burst pipe (and I imagine reading some of these posts) upon checkin I was given a letter explaining what had happened, and apologized about the inconvenience. Since wifi is free in the lobby, and it was in such a mess, wifi was free in my room. I would've given it a 5, but the pressure in the shower was REALLY low. And the water only got warm, not very hot, I'm not sure if this was due to the burst pipe or not. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service Still Exists!”
Reviews.Author: Kegt V
Reviews.Content: I stayed this particular Westin for the first time on December 2nd, and will stay here from now on every time I come to San Diego. Heres why: I fell ill upon eating at a seafood restaurant the day prior. It was awful and quite dusgesting being I threw up in the bath tub of all places. I called the front desk to inform them of the mess. Five minutes later, this very professional, sweet, and caring gentleman by the name of Nathan Nichols from In Room Dining came with a tray containing Sprite, an assortment of teas, and bread to help me get through this thing. What was even more impressive is he sat with me, went in the bathroom and got me a cool wet towel and placed ut on my forehead. He told me he will stay with me to make sure I am cared for. Never in my 20 plus years staying at a hotel have I had this kind of service, especially nowadays when customer service is pretty much non existent. This gesture truly shows that customer service still exists, one just has to go to the right place. Nathan came back around noonish, and brought me chicken noodle soup complimentary while on HIS break! I offered Nathan a tip for his time, but he declined stating,"we here at Westin assist our clients for the pleasure it gives us, not to get tipped.". I am forever a Westin client now. Thank you Nathan for making me feel like I was at home, and not just in a hotel. Also I want to thank the manager for allowing me to check out late and the first desk associate who made sure I was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay, but management could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: NZHarry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business purposes for 12 nights. Found all staff extremely helpful. Room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. The in-room wifi speed and signal quality was good. On the 3rd day of our stay a water pipe burst in the lobby. Although such things are unexpected, a note to each guest from management acknowledging the inconvenience of reduced space and construction noise would have been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been better, but the staff tried hard”
Reviews.Author: Megaru
Reviews.Content: The good first - The staff was very accommodating and friendly - housekeeping honored my request to remove feather pillows, bedspreads, etc before I checked in (allergies) - alot of hotels don't get this right - but this one did. I was pleasantly surprised. They also removed some of the wireless charges from my bill as they bill per device instead of by room #... Housekeeping and Room Service were pretty good as well, room was clean, nicely decorated, etc. The unfortunate - a pipe had burst in the hotel so as other travelers have indicated - they were in a state of repair. I understand that and things happen... it was a little annoying - they tried to accommodate it. But there were little things that seemed to indicate they didn't *quite* have their act together, my room was missing some toiletries when I checked in. The TV didn't get a number of channels (broken?) - I used my iPad to watch my shows and the internet connection was spotty/lagging. Also the hotel charges for each device connection to wireless (so laptop and iPad results in double billing), they were disorganized about my checkout date, and had the wrong date, one employee told me I couldn't extend it as they were full, but the next day another employee was able to extend me once a manager showed them how... Bottom line - I probably wouldn't stay there again - but for a work trip - it was absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at an unbeatable rate”
Reviews.Author: aretiredtraveler
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a really good web rate for this past Thanksgiving weekend. We have stayed at this hotel in the past, and found it has comfortable beds and an attractive modern decor. The room is plainly decorated in soft hues, with a stark white bed cover, so it is peaceful--especially if you get one of the upper floors above the street noise. The lobby was under going renovation, which meant that casual dining in the coffee bar was less than comfortable, but we did not use this facility. The staff is excellent and service-friendly. It's location is within a long walk of many of the sights and venues in downtown. It is a short walk from the Amtrak station, which is how we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rest!”
Reviews.Author: LJPmom
Reviews.Content: Only a quick stay before heading home. Lex was very helpful and accommodating. Cassi was a ray sunshine with my coffee. The bed was "heavenly" and the room spotless. The contruction, while unsightly, did not affect the quality of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lesley W
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect and within walking distance of the Gaslamp Quarter, Coronado Ferry terminal, Balboa Park and Little Italy. Our room had amazing views of the Coronado Bridge and the Bay and was very quiet. Our Concierge, Thi Nguyen, was both friendly and informative. I have worked in the Luxury Hotel business and would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: barbs j
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Westin and Starwood Properties. I must say I was very disappointed in this Westin. First of all, after driving all day, I parked apparently on the wrong side of the Hotel. I went into the hotel but could not get any information from anyone where I should park. I had made my reservations 7 mos. ahead of time. Second-Expensive rooms and on top of it extra charge for internet.....extra charge for parking your car......30 or 40 dollars a day. Third- Food is terrible! I had room service and it was unedible. So I tried the bar area and the food was also so bad that I took one bite and couldn't eat it. The bartender said he agreed and brought me something else. Fourth- The bathtub faucet dripped all the time, I tried to turn it off but could not fix it. The bathroom was out of date and completely difficult to get in and out of the tub and shower! The Westin in Pasadena could teach this Westin how to treat their customers and also how to cook food that is edible. I have stayed at the Westin in Pasadena at least 10 times. The rooms are much nicer with free internet, bellhops are much more informed and professional.. Parking not as expensive. San Diego needs to redo everything about this hotel. Extremely disappointed in this Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and it was fine even though they had their own problems”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a convention. Found it cheaper to book via hotels.com (£232 for the two night inclusive of all taxes, etc.) than book at the conference rate. Arrived to find that they had had a major aircon fluid leak (someone mentioned 50,000 gallons) and a lot of the 1st two floors of the hotel was taped off and sealed with a temporary front desk. This was obviously a massive leak and had a major impact but did not in anyway affect my stay so congratulations to the hotel staff. It's a good hotel and good central location. Gym is adequate (from memory about 4 joggers and 2 x-trainers and a bike or two). Eat in the (temporary) bar on the first night and it was fine. Conference food was good. Room was started upmarket Westin. I didn't use the hotel wifi as it was about $15 per day per device! A fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice but too much added expenses”
Reviews.Author: OCaloha
Reviews.Content: The location of the Westin San Diego was perfect for us. It was walking distance to the train station and many restaurants. The lobby area was airy and nicely decorated with plants. The room was spacious and included a desk, lounge chair, and refrigerator. However, we ended up having to move to another room because of a leak in the bathroom and the room was smaller than the first. We felt they could have given us some kind of bonus for the hassle and nothing was said about it when checking out. Therefore, we would have to say the service was just adequate. We have had mishaps at other mid range hotels and were given a discount on the room for a night or a discount coupon for one of their restaurants as well as an apology again when checking out. Nothing was said about it at the Westin. In addition, the cost of parking was outrageous. Since the daily self-parking service was not affiliated with the hotel we ended spending $80 just for parking for only 2 nights. If we knew or had the differences in the parking services more thoroughly explained (the 2 options were just mentioned) we would have chosen the hotels valet parking instead. Daily parking meant that anytime you left and came back you ended paying the daily rate twice and more if you left the hotel more than once. Another negative is that WiFi access was not free in your room. If you are spending as much for the rooms as you are, you should get free access at least for a specified period of time. It was only free if you were in the lobby area. Doubtful that we will be returning to this Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: pecangirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in November 2011 for the Packers/Chargers game. It was a fantastic experience. Centrally located to the Gas Lamp District and the ocean, easy walking. Close to trolley and bus stop. Comfy beds and clean facility. The pool, hot tub and gym facilities are top notch. Friendly, helpful staff. Excellent van service. I couldn't find a complaint if i tried!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: rvernon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this specific property 3-4 times over the past few years and it is always good, but it only takes 1 or 2 small experiences within the whole to keep this from being a GREAT place to stay while in SD. I sought-out better accomodations and there were not any, which was fine, but then when I made a few other simple requests, they were not able to accomodate and were actually a bit rude in their responses.

Reviews.Title: “fun for packers fans!”
Reviews.Author: alexis s
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin San Diego for the Packer's game! Other than the wet weather, San Diego was awesome! The bartender in particular was super friendly and fun and did a great job as we gave her a hard time for wearing her philip rivers jersey! The hotel itself is also very nice! Had no problems here and had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room Service and Bell Desk”
Reviews.Author: babs g
Reviews.Content: Very clean building and room. Room Service attendant named Nathan gave 5 star service!!!! Hope to see him move up the chain at Westin. Vans to the airport were free! Overall very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Held a Meeting there”
Reviews.Author: PandMinDC
Reviews.Content: Our organization held a meeting at the Westin San Diego. The meeting facilities were great and it was in a great location for our attendees. We have used this hotel several times in the past and have a future meeting booked there as well. Randy in banquets did a super-fabulous job of taking care of us!!! He was so nice and friendly, which is great for stressed-out planners! :) Overall, the hotel was great and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent with two exceptions...."”
Reviews.Author: 2streetr
Reviews.Content: Very good overall value; courteous and helpful staff. Plumbing needs work (noisy sink drain; leaky faucet in tub). Two exceptions: restaurant: rude server in AM; continental breakfast should include cheeses, cold cuts, etc. like "on the continent." PM: worst hamburger ever: like dog food; could have done much better down the street at Wendy's. When leaving for airport at 0630, went up to van driver (hotel uniform) and asked if my wife and I could get ride to airport. Large van contained only two guys in aircrew uniforms and their luggage. Even though we were literally standing at the curb, he told us to go inside and "sign up" for the van leaving in 15-20 minutes, instead of letting us climb aboard. Very discourteous finale to an otherwise fine stay. I'd use the hotel again, but with these reservations. Thanks, 2STREETR.

Reviews.Title: “Too Short”
Reviews.Author: Devin D
Reviews.Content: Was only able to stay for a 5 day conference, but thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff was great, the food was wonderful including a very filling breakfast, and the room was very comfortable. Would stay there again if/when given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Visitor”
Reviews.Author: JandRLA
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location for those arriving on AMTRAK and still walking close to Gas Light and Convention or other downtown locations. Room furnishings, yes the wonderful beds, are all that their reputation says. Rooms are nice and quiet. Restaurant has a super breakfast buffet, cold or hot choice, with associated pricing. Works well for those early morning departures. Good workout room for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan K
Reviews.Content: All I can say is in addition to all of the great amenities that your hotel had to offer, I was really impressed with the bed and how comfortable it was. Each night I laid on that mattress, I was literally out like a light in less than 10 minutes. For me, how well I sleep is the most important thing I consider when booking a hotel. That said, I look forward to making the Westin my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Bettie S
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the whole experience very much. The staff were professional, friendly and welcoming. The ambience of the hotel was luxurious, yet comfortable. The room was lovely and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk and valet parking”
Reviews.Author: Hoolagurl
Reviews.Content: Melissa at the front desk was very smug. She didn't wait for me to completely ask my question about my bill before she said, "what am I explaining to you" in a very rude way. I waited almost 1/2 hour for my car and saw someone who came later get their car before me. The only reason I got my car in 1/2 hour was because I went to the podium and looked for my key. It was a single key and behind the others way down the line. It had obviously been overlooked and I was told I would have to wait until all of the 10 others before me were served. I was there before them!! Luckily a woman valet saw the problem and grabbed my key. She took a little while, but finally got my car. There has to be a better way to line the keys up. Mine fell behind the others and was hidden. The keys should be hung up on a rack that is numbered so everyone can see them. I also know that folks who gave a tip upon coming to the podium got served first. I know of a woman who waited 45 minutes!! Unfair!!! There was also a cheerio on the floor in my room and some weird white stuff on the carpet near my bed. The room hadn't been cleaned thoroughly. Other than that, the conference rooms were great in that they were near the sleeping rooms - easy to get to in a short amount of time. The food was great.

Reviews.Title: “LES Meeting”
Reviews.Author: h j
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel over others in the area for the good cost-to-value ratio. I was attending a conference at the Marriott 4 blocks away, and found this to be about a 7-minute walk and about 90 dollars a night less. Regarding the hotel and my stay, I was in a double with a view of the water (between other high-rises) and it was very quiet on the 18th floor. Lower floors may have some issues. My infrequent interactions with the Staff found them to be fine. The place is not known for its restaurant, but what I did get was fine but nothing special. The room itself was very nice for the cost.-no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location....”
Reviews.Author: stonewithnomoss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to a cruise. It is really within walking distance of the cruise pier if you don't bring much luggage (doubtful for a week's cruise). The gaslight district, the San Diego Trolley, the railway station, the waterfront .... they are all right nearby. It is clean and well appointed. The price was right since we got a discounted room in conjunction with the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Room renovation on a Saturday”
Reviews.Author: Henry V
Reviews.Content: My stay was overall very good. Excellent front desk personnel. Only problem was that on Saturday night when we returned someone decided to paint something in a room on our floor. The AC grills were left outside on the hallway on a trolley and the room door propped open with the result that the whole floor smelled of paint and chemicals. When we open our room the smell was overwhelming. I called the manager and Lex, a supervisor called back., He said he would look into to it but a half hour later the trolley was still there and the door still propped open with the same smell everywhere (other guests came out of their room and also complained). This is not something that should be done on a weekend nor in the evening hours. It's disappointing that Lex did not do something about it nor did he follow up with us. Compared to the rest of our stay and service he seriously lacked.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, great location”
Reviews.Author: Matt H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for an academic conference conducted there. As far as conference hotels stays go, in my experience, I've never stayed in one with a better atmosphere. The staff was unfailingly helpful and polite; the room was very comfortable; workout facilities were top-notch. And the location is hard to beat--easy walking distance to both the waterfront and the Gaslamp district, both of which hold a wide range of fine restaurants. Last but not least, it was EXTREMELY convenient to the airport, with a free shuttle: flying out on Southwest, it took us only 30 minutes from the hotel lobby to our assigned gate. I would definitely stay there again whenever in San Diego, and I recommend it most highly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty reliable Westin”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyQ
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay in Westins when I'm on biz travel. I'm a Starwood loyalist, and W's are just too noisy for me. This Westin was in a handy location (close to the Gas Lamp, but not *in* the Gas Lamp) was consistent in most ways with the others, except I found the front desk and maid service to be lackluster. The girl I checked in with was cold and blasé, and when I got back to my room at the end of the day, the bathroom was not neatened at all; the maid only put a couple of products on the counter. A container of my face cleaser was even turned sideways and was leaking onto the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & completely servicable”
Reviews.Author: norodo
Reviews.Content: This Westin is located near the Sante Fe station, the Harbor tours, Seaport Village etc. It's also a 20 minute walk/5 min trolley ride to the Gaslamp District...you can travel along the avenue parallel to the harbor or meander through the civic area into gaslight, if the local, colorful population doesn't dissuade you. (We did it daily.) The hotel is 1/2 hotel, 1/2 corporate offices, and the lobby feels disjointed and uninviting. The bar has no sense of place, but once you're in the room, it's comfortable, with great sheets, double-headed shower, OK towels (not too soft) and plastic disposable cups instead of glass. Rooms also offer Starbucks coffee and an empty mini-fridge. The free shuttle to/from the airport was a great bonus, making it a strong value overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: JennaMarie360
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Our room had a great view of the bay and the city. It was a short walk to the gaslamp quarter but far enough away that it was quiet at night. It was also only a 10min walk in the other direction to the bay. The staff was very helpful and over-the-top welcoming. They were able to answer all of our questions and reccomend attractions and restaurants. The king-sized bed in our room was amazing, we slept very well each night of our stay. We were very pleased to find starbucks coffee and tea in our room as well! The roof top pool certainly looked better in the pictures on their website. The pool and hot tub are in need of repair and cleaning. However, the other aspects of this hotel out shine their dingy pool so we will still be reccomending it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice -”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl H
Reviews.Content: The location and property were perfect! The front desk girl (dark hair) was rude, but everyone else was very nice and helpful! Concierge both days was super friendly! I would definitely stay here again - This was amy frist trup to San Diego and I loved the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: galegood
Reviews.Content: After having problems with the reservation (our fault) and almost leaving to find another hotel, the manager was very helpful in trying to talk us into keeping our reservation. The staff was excellent, rooms were very clean and large. The bartenders in the lounge during happy hour were excellent. (Thank you for the nail polish remover). :)Great location if you like to walk. Breakfast was delicious. We we able to pick off the buffett for my 2 year old grandson at no cost. Look forward to staying there next year for our annual family visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff, food not so much”
Reviews.Author: Macahwe
Reviews.Content: We were here for a week for a confernce and really enjoyed our stay! Being walkers it was an idea location, close to everything, Concierge was very helpful providing routes and tmes. Fourtunately she also gave us great tips to eat in all price ranges. Would we stay here again..ABSOLUTELY. Would we eat here again.......... NO. We are returning in Nov for another week for a family event but will eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: shannonff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 12 days its a great location for all the attraction in San Diego and surrounding area. the hotel is close to the harbour and the Gaslamp Quarter all within walking distance also Horton plaza shopping. If you want to go further a field the trolley and bus are close by with a great day pass available that can be used on both which will get you to Seaworld, San Diego zoo and all the museums in balboa park. The room was large with coffee making facility and fridge the bed was comfortable and i love the bath robe. the staff were very good they helped me arrange travel to Disney and Universal studios in L.A. A lot of people complain about having to pay for wi-fi but it was free in the reception area which was fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: CA_Shanna
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference overnight in october. I walked to gaslamp one night and little italy the second night. The food at the hotel was really good and the staff were very friendly. I was able to check in early and have a late checkout. I was very pleased overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: BigmanBrighton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to my cruise. The location is ideal for the harbour and the trolley services. A much better and newer hotel than it's namesake in The Gaslamp Quarter that was only a 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly pillows, tiny room, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jeremyfd
Reviews.Content: Briefly: room small, expensive, mediocre fittings but with great view. Pillows smelled old and greasy so we asked them to be changed, same turned up so no better. Hotel is in an office block, strangely restaurant was closed at lunch, there's a bar but no cafeteria so no place to eat out of hours. The killer is the price, way too high for what you get, and then you pay parking on top. This is no Westin, it's just a hotel that charges too much without the corresponding service.

Reviews.Title: “I love Westin!”
Reviews.Author: EB0109
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I decided to splash out a little and book this hotel. As I was travelling alone I wanted to make sure I was somewhere safe and fairly central. The location is excellent, in walking distance of the Gaslamp quarter, Seaport Village, public transport stops and the ferries. My room was very clean and was well maintained during my stay. Toiletries and complimentary water bottles were replaced daily. Hotel staff especially the concierges were extremely helpful in planning my days and even came up with discount coupons for some attractions. I saved $20 on Seaworld! The rooftop pool was an added bonus after long days on my feet. I loved the elevators on the outside of the building - brilliant views on the way up to my room! I also felt safe walking alone at night back to the hotel. Overall I couldn't have had a better stay!
