The hotel also featured a 24 hour fitness room and pool (not 24 hours) which I checked out and it all looked very well kept, and a massage studio. I paid $350USD for two nights for a room with a King Bed, my room was very well kept, extremely clean, including luxurious toiletries and a robe, I didn't hear any noise and was very comfortable. The only thing the room didn't include was very internet which was a shame however it is available in the lobby area (you have to resign in every 30 minutes). There is a great cafe which appears to be attached to the hotel but is actually an independant business - highly reccomend going there for breakfast - yummy and 1/3 of the price of the hotel. I was by myself so the room was quite large for me and I wanted to stay on in San Diego and not pay as much so I moved to a smaller hotel (2 blocks away - the Sofia - see my review on this). I would stay here again but only if i was able to split the cost with another room mate or if I could get a cheaper rate. Another nice area to stay in would be La Jolla - gorgeous upscale area about 1/2 hour away from downtown on transit but not sure how much rooms would be out there.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best hotel stays.”
Reviews.Author: lavenderlady52
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling with my job for over 20 years and my current stay at the Westin was one of my best experiences. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted in a very warm way. Once I got to the check in counter, a young lady named Helle provided superb attention to detail. She made me feel very welcomed and greeted me by name every time I walked by the registration. I really enjoyed my stay at your hotel and I will definitely come back with my family. Thank you for your exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Westin San DIego”
Reviews.Author: omi1218
Reviews.Content: Melissa Humble at the front desk was friendly and gave excellent customer service. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “You should BE A 5 STAR HOTEL.Our stay was the best.”
Reviews.Author: jgibbs_11
Reviews.Content: All services could not have been any better.Employees very helpful and friendly.You do not need any tips or guidelines.KEEP IT UP. Joe and Sharn Gibbs

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Close to Cruise Terminal and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: IanKAus
Reviews.Content: We departed our cruise and was an easy walk to the hotel, even with luggage. We were able to check-in to our room and even received an upgrade to a bayview room. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Complimentary bottled water in room. Easy walk to shopping area and Gaslamp. A few homeless people on the streets, however this seems common in whole downtown area of San Diego. Also provided complimentary shuttle to airport. Highly recommend this hotel and would return when next in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LMat0s
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 902 from May 11 to May 14. On the evening of the day I checked out, May 14, 2011, I realized that I had left the pajamas that my late husband had given me as a gift and immediately contacted the hotel manager, Lex, to inquire about them. He said he would find out for me and called me back to say that no one had found them and that I should call the following day so that he could speak to the people that made the room. My cousin stopped by the hotel the following day, after taking me to the airport, and Lex implied that I was mistaken because no one had turned in or seen the pajamas. It is very clear to me that whoever made the room took them and no one is taking action to get them back for me. I don't expect any of you to understand my grief. I lost the love of my life and I wanted to wear the pajamas that he gave me for the rest of my life. I need for you to conduct an investigation and recover my pajamas. They are Ralph Lauren, cotton, long sleeved, long pants, white with purple stripes. Yesterday, I tried speaking to Lex, but he was busy. Elisa took my message, but Lex never called me back. I would appreciate very much your contacting me at (956)337-8610 or (956)724-3397 to tell me that you did what needed to be done and that you have recovered my pajamas. I just cannot believe that something like this is happening in a hotel like the Westin. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Sincerely, Laura S. Matos

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff at the Westin San Diego”
Reviews.Author: travellover511
Reviews.Content: Melissa from the front desk and Andrew, our Concierge, were awesome. They enhanced our experience with their helpfulness and knowledge of the area, giving us suggestions for our stay that really made for a very enjoyable trip. Though our experience at the lounge was a little lacking, I think it was due to a busy time. The lounge seemed a bit understaffed for the time of day (happy hour). Also, free Wi/Fi should be an automatic in this day and age. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate another visit and will recommend the Westin San Diego to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Employee Melissa Humble was GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: ccowchip
Reviews.Content: The Westin has beautiful hotel rooms, and this one was no exception. When I had a problem, employee Melissa Humble handled it perfectly, with diplomacy and tact. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but not the best with young family”
Reviews.Author: collarfamily
Reviews.Content: Probably my mistake, I was looking for a convenient location to stay with 2 adults and 2 kids (8 and 5) and of course clean rooms. I certainly found this at the Westin but it really wasnt the right hotel for us. The hotel is full of corporate people, there on business etc and we felt out of place. We had a few issues during our stay, firstly if you book a tour you need to clarify which entrance you are going to be picked up from! We arrived half an hour early and sat in the front entrance waiting for our tour and even told the man on the desk what we were there for! Our pick up time came and went and no sign of our tour...decided to ring and were advised that they had been and gone...we were at the wrong entrance! Apparantly the side door is the main entrance, so just keep that in mind if you have tours booked! My son also lost some lego in the room which we are unsure about! The location itself was great, walking distance to Horton Plaza Shopping and to the Gaslamp Quarter for dinner and also down to the harbour so we enjoyed that. I used the fitness centre which was clean and spacious too. Wish we had more time in San Diego, it seems like a wonderful place with a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: italy05_11
Reviews.Content: After checking in and not sure what our room was Melissa upgraded us and got us comfortable asap. She then recommended us to a great restaurant in Little Italy "Bencotto" and then the next morning to a great cafe in the same area for Cappacino's. Kudos to you Melissa and you will here back from us on our next visit...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: prasad0923
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Westin locations that I have stayed. The rooms are nice and clean, the staff are very friendly and welcoming and the location is good. I stayed on the 19th floor with partial bay view. They only have valet parking but as we were waiting for our car in front of the hotel, we saw paid parking just opposite to the hotel and looks like these guys use the same parking lot for valet as well. We dined at the restaurant downstairs and it was nice and clean. Overall the service was good and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...once you get there”
Reviews.Author: KRoman4
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego and celebrated St. Patty's day at the Shamrock. The hotel was a reasonable walk to the festivities and tourist attractions. Our only complaint was the poor service involving the airport shuttle. After a long flight from the east coast, we arrived and contacted the hotel for the shuttle service. After waiting 30 min. we contacted the hotel to find that the shuttle had broken down and a replacement vehicle was being sent. We ended up waiting 50 minutes! Exhausted we got to the Westin where we expected to have a late dinner but the dining area was closing in 10 minutes. So after check-in, we fell into bed with our empty stomachs. We expected a manager to contact us and apologize for the shuttle mishap but that never happened. After that night, our stay was just fine. The hotel was comfortable and the staff friendly. The locale was perfect for where we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice stay...but”
Reviews.Author: lales2
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay at your hotel was pleasant. However, a bad "tone" was set at check-in when I advised a person, who I believed to be a manager, that I felt that the signs posted outside the hotel regarding parking were insufficient and confusing. Rather than pleasantly agree and indicate that he would pass on my observations to management he, instead, adamantly disagreed with me and proceeded to engage in an argument. I told him that the Westin Hotel chain was my favorite destination when traveling and that I was not used to being treated in that manner by hotel staff on any level. As I stated at the outset, my overall stay was pleasant and other staff members met my expectations for Westin, but I just did not appreciate having to begin my stay with an argument with a manager. I'm sure I'll ultimately forgive Westin, but I may not forget anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JulieB928
Reviews.Content: The Westin is very centrally located just over a block away from the trolley, very close to the beautiful walkway along the harbor and the staff is excellent....they make you feel like you are family!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bet-the-Jet
Reviews.Content: We love Westin. They are pet friendly so we can take our two small dogs which helps make our time away more enjoyable. This hotel is in a ideal location. You can park the car and walk to many of the best restaurants, Hoton Plaza, Little Italy (we went for Art Walk) and many other great San Diego attractions. Staff is friendly and accomodating. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay, but weak reservation system”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_Hanson
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hotel was great; no complaints other than the pricey internet (which I can get for free if I go to a $35/night Motel 8). But I just can not understand how my name was removed from my own reservation and replaced with someone else's name. A week after I had already received successful confirmation E-mails with my correct name on them, I suddenly started receiving E-mails to my correct E-mail address but with someone else's name on them. When I called the hotel, they said "our records show that you asked us to change the reservation to this other name". I made them fix it on the spot, and thought all was well. Then, the day I am leaving for the airport to fly out there, I get a bunch more E-mails confirming my reservation -- with this other guy's name on the E-mails again! Very frustrating. I had to show up blind, because when I tried to E-mail the reservations E-mail address, I got back a response that my E-mail was "not forwarded to an agent." "Thank you and have a nice day." Really? When I arrived at the front desk, sure enough they had no record of my name. As if I'd never registered at all. The only reason I was able to successfully stay at the hotel was because it was a large conference, and I was walking in with my boss who assured the clerk I was a legitimate conference attendee. This would have been catastrophic if I'd been by myself. The clerk commented that many other people had experienced similar problems. Yikes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Meeting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kraffaniello
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to host your meeting/event. The staff on-site is efficient and flexible, making any last minute changes more than possible to enact. They work hard to keep to a set budget and truly enjoy organizing an amazing event. Their meeting space setup is lovely and some of the rooms feature patios where catered lunches can be served. The sleeping rooms are very comfortable and have desks and wireless internet connection options. The bedding is very soft and the bathrooms are a good size. At first I was a little hesitant to hold a training event here due to the location, but surprisingly the area provided the added benefit of being close to a section of San Diego referred to as Little Italy. With Little Italy being only a few blocks away, there are several restaurants within walking distance to take groups to each evening. I can definitely say that the highlight of this hotel is the excellent customer service. We have several events throughout the year and we always check for availability at this venue first.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: simply_je
Reviews.Content: not much to say, I would recommend it to anybody :) just the parking is a bit too expensive ($32 a day) but it's very comfortable to have it there

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: lovestogolfinaz
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Westin. We had great service from the moment we arrived. The valet service was super helpful with directions, the front desk provided us with an amazing room with a view when we requested an upgrade, and our room was super clean every night and always love those heavenly beds! Love the atrium, great for morning coffee to sit and relax. Location was great, close to Little Italy, even closer to the Fish Market, our must eat restaurant when in town!

Reviews.Title: “Trains, wake-up calls and overbilling”
Reviews.Author: Barbadosdad
Reviews.Content: 1) I would not recommend this location unless you accept managements complimentary offer of ear plugs. The 4:a.m. commuter train two blocks away makes it impossible to get a good night's sleep.. Which is a blessing because.... 2) Two out of two days I stays there my wake up call never came. (That's not fair...one actually did come at 5 a.m. when I had asked for 7 a.m.) I set the wake via the telephone system AND personnaly called them in. And for this extra service one gets.... 3) An extra bill. I stayed two nights of a three night reservation. I knew at 8 a.m. on day two I would not need day three. Alas...I coudl not provide 24 notice of cancellation. The grand Westin pocketed an additional $300 for a room never slept in. Nice work when you can get and you can get FOR AN ENTIRE OFFICE STAFF that didn't need that extra night. But...they made up for by.... 4) Billing for parking. A mere $25 per night for the car I never drove. Nope...took a taxi. I was highly disappointed with the service, billing and noisy accomodation. Had teh same occured at the Marriott, Hyatt, or even the Hilton, each of those establishments woudl have (and have in the past) waived the extra night $300 fee. Let me reiterate that the Westin not only failed to waive my fee but also the fee of everyone in my group that encountered the same circumstances. $300 per night X person = I'm going to the Hilton with my staff next visit.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: NYer000
Reviews.Content: The only thing the hotel has going for it is basically location. Train is right there. Airport is nearby. And the San Diego Bay is a few blocks down, where you can catch all the city tours. Little Italy is a 10 minute walk away so that was really nice. This hotel is decent but wasn't what I expected. As another reviewer commented, the shape of the room was so odd and uncomfortable.. It really did look like they are using every inch possible to rent out. Huge disappointment with the room here. Also, the carpet felt so gross. Never seen worse yet. Bathroom was decent. Staff was alright, but not too friendly. When you're on a vacation, you expect smiles. I know they're at work so they aren't too thrilled, but the people paying their salaries are on vacation away from THEIR jobs and want a happy time there. So a smile shouldn't be too much to ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Mistakes”
Reviews.Author: pamelasailor7
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the hotel staff made a bunch of mistakes and my trip was a comedy of errors. Next time I will stay at the other Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but definitely has its serious flaws.”
Reviews.Author: NapMountain
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to San Diego for business, and the hotel that was holding the event I covered (photography) had already booked all the rooms available at their promotional rates, which were still $100 higher than the Westin. I'd heard good things about the Westin chain and decided I'd give it a try. I find it difficult to believe that there are that many hotels around that don't have enough parking to accommodate their guests. Every night I got a different story upon returning from a long day's work. The first night was normal, arrived back at the hotel, self parked and that was that (keep in mind when booking, you'll be paying $24 a day to self park). The next night I came back and the gate to the self parking was closed. I pulled up to the valet area and asked if it was full, and they said no, there are just certain days of the week that the gate closes automatically at night (the building is shared with other businesses). They had someone go over and open the gate, done deal. The next night, same story with the gate. I pulled up to valet and the guy looked at me like he had no idea what I was talking about. I asked if the lot was full and he said yeah. I said that I had a bunch of equipment I needed to unload, could I just pull down to the elevators and unload it / take it up to my room? He said sure, as long as you come back out. I got down there and saw that there were in fact a few spots. I unloaded my gear and tried to leave the structure. The gentleman that takes in money for parking asked where my ticket was, and I explained that the guys had let me in the valet ramp to unload and I didn't have a ticket. He didn't seem to get it, so I explained again. Eventually he said it'd be his butt that would get in trouble, and I said talk to your valet guys then. He let me out. The next night, when I had an assistant with me in her car, we were told to park in the public structure across the street from the hotel, as the hotel was once again full. Now I have to park in an unsecured, open-air structure that isn't even connected to the hotel. A block or two from the city jail. Nice. The next evening, I was told I should park on the street a block or two down from the hotel, seems every other day one side of the street gets cleaned, and I'd be safe if I left before 8am. That was the case, and while inconvenient, it worked out. All in all, not the best experience in terms of parking. I guess the idea is that I should just spend more money and use the valet services. The food at the hotel was pretty good. Issue being, their restaurant closes an hour earlier than it says it's supposed to in the guide book that was in my room. I was busy working till usually 9 or 10 every night at a hotel on the water covering some events. I'd return to my room bushed and ready to relax / have a good meal. Unfortunately for me, dinner was already done being served. Their late night menu sufficed, but still, how about thinking of the people that work a bit later than everyone else. One night I got back earlier, and decided to eat at the restaurant. Got down there, and was told that they had closed at 9 (book in my room said 10). They advised that my room service menu offered pretty much the same items that they serve. Still, sometimes it's nice to not eat from a tray in front of your tv. I was kind of amazed that I had to pay for internet in this day and age. Would be nice if they offered wired for free, wireless for a charge. They definitely don't seem to be catering to business travelers. Lastly, when my check out day arrived, they slipped my invoice under the door. I was given two separate sheets, with similar totals and a difference in charges. When I went down to the front desk to discuss the charges with them (discrepancy in laundry fees, etc) I was greeted by only a trainee. Another couple that was waiting at the counter was amazed as well by this, here it was check out time, and the only front desk staff was a new guy (no issue with him or being new, but that's a hell of a way to get someone to learn their job). He couldn't properly explain what the fee I questioned was, and said it was probably internet related. I said no, this feel (marked internet!) was the internet fee. He took the copies and said a manager was available, and disappeared. He returned sans manager, and sans one of the receipts, and still had the same answer, that the totals were the same and not to worry. At this point I gave up, as I had to be working about 15 minutes from then. Oh well. On the plus side, the heavenly bed was really nice. The air conditioning worked well. View of the construction site and jail were kind of neat for a change. Be warned that there must be a fire station nearby, as sirens were heard pretty regularly

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again....”
Reviews.Author: Runforit32530
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a one night stay as we were doing a bike race the following Sunday morning. When we arrived for check-in, at 2:50pm, we were told there were no rooms available. After expressing a bit of frustration and demanding the employee call the manager, our room all of a sudden became ready and available. That wasn't the end of the world; however, things would only get worse into the night. The entire night all you could hear, every 30 minutes or so, was the sound of the water running through the pipes - imagine a little drum playing all night. This was not a result of our water use but instead was caused by everyone else using their water/bathrooms! We had to be up by 5:30 am and kept hoping it would stop - I don't know about you but I don't want bunch of men in my room in the middle of the night fixing the pipes...how could I ever go back to sleep. When we were checking out, we brought up the problem; however, the employees behind the desk looked at us like we were crazy and hardly offered a word in an attempt to acknowledge our dissatisfaction with their hotel. I couldn't believe how unintersted the staff acted.. The hotel room came out to more than $250.00 (including random fees they charge) and believe me , it was not worth it! I could have stayed at the Holiday Day Inn and had a better nights sleep and service.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: golftina
Reviews.Content: had a company event and wanted to stay downtown . The westin is a great place to stay, great location and they have a very friendly concierge Molly who knows here town. Gave great suggestions for eating and shopping and setting up dinner plans.!!! Thank you Molly. Room service breakfast was delicious, a large portion and great presentation. We had a great view of downtown and the bay and made for a terrific experience !!!! Thank you to all the great staff. Love this place !!!! The bed was so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay for business”
Reviews.Author: watergirl933
Reviews.Content: Overall had a good experience at the Westin. Staff friendly and helpful. Room service and breakfast buffet were very good. Only two complaints were that the tub did not drain very well and there was not a mini-fridge available in our room. From experiences at other similarly priced hotels and even less expensive ones- a mini-refridgerator has become standard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.......but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Treetop_67
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Diego was just about what I expected - however, the noise factor caused me to rate it lower. There is construction across the street which awoke me on saturday morning. I was not there during the week - but it is probable that it would louder. That coupled with the thin walls and my room windows being above the pool just was too much noise for me. I could hear the guests on both sides and was surprised just how thin the walls were. They were not exceptionally loud but I could hear the TV, normal conversations, water/shower running and doors slamming until 1:30 in the morning so I did not get a very good nights sleep. If you stay here request not to be on the Broadway wing as that is where the construction and pool is if you prefer peace and quiet in the morning and during the day. My room was spacious as I believe it was a handicapped room. It was clean and in good condition. I liked the location - we walked everywhere...Embarcadero, Gaslamp, Balboa Park, Little Italy.....lots of good restaurants and things to do closeby. Another annoying things was the charge for the computer time and paper in the business center.........surprised as this is usually a complimentary service at most hotels nowadays. We used the shuttle from the airport as we did not have need for a car - worked great - good ammenity.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Momand2teendaughters
Reviews.Content: A friend and I took our teenage daughters for a quick 2 day trip to San Diego. We decided to experience public transportation, so took Amtrak. From the moment we arrived at 9am... our stay at the Westin was perfect. Josh checked us in (very) early. Then we asked the concierge for best way to get to the zoo, and he had the hotel driver (reserved for airport shuttles) drive the 6 of us over to the zoo. Mike (driver) was awesome - and showed us where to pick up bus to get back to hotel, but suggested calling hotel to see if driver available. He also suggested FIliiipi's for dinner...which was fabulous. We got back to hotel and asked if driver was available to take us to Ghiradelli. Leif dropped us off, and even came back to get us just half an hour later. The next day, the concierge gave us trolley routes to SDSU (college tour). All in all, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return - and without a car. We took train, trolley, and bus.. all were great and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: HUNNA14
Reviews.Content: Was treated like royalty from the moment we arrived. Valet guys, even though busy, were extremely helpful and respectful. The Front Office Team, especially Leon Williams, made it a point to understand what our plans were during our visit, and provided us with the necessary information that we needed to ensure that we arrived at our destinations on time and with little effort. He was very polite and accomodating when we asked if our two rooms could be placed next to each other. After receiving the keys, we asked what the special occasion was, and my friend told him that it was my birthday. He wished me a sincere Happy Birthday & made it a point to wish us a nice evening when we departed. I returned back to the room only to find that the Front Office Team had placed a card, Bottle of Champagne, fresh strawberries, mint, dipping chocolate, and raw sugar thanking me for allowing the Westin to share in my birthday celebrations. It was a wonderful way to end my fabulous night in the Gaslamp District. I will definitely be going back for many more birthdays, anniversarys, etc. I can't say thank you enough!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lack of customer service training”
Reviews.Author: capperju
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my baby Grandson.I am a single grandparent who looks after my Grandson quite a bit.I decided to take him to Seaworld and stay at the Westin as it was the closest to the railway station.Once checked in and hauled my bags up to the room (no one offered to help).I needed to use the business center.I carried my Grandson downstairs thinking it would not take long to find out where the business center was.I waited at the concierge desk for about five minutes (seemed much longer as I was carrying a toddler).She was given loads of information about San Diego.Never once did she acknowledge me even though she had to of seen me (I only needed one question answering) All the FD were busy checking in so I waited.eventually I walked overto look at the menu outside the restaurant,I was away from the concierge desk literally one minute and when I got back to the concierge desk another family just arrived,instead of her saying something or acknowledging our existence she started to help them they started off "what is there to do in the area" Oh boy this was going to take forever.Five minutes later it was my turn by now I was peeved at the lack of customer service (use your initiative if a person is carrying a baby are they likely to take much of your time up).I asked where the business center was and she told me I said ok and left she shouted to me in a loud but Sarcastic tone "THANK YOU" When I asked her for a comment card she said they didn't have one and I could tell her if there was a problem. Josh at the FD was great.The restaurant staff were great.Housekeeping sucked never got my room cleaned as I was out all day,got back to the room at 4:30 pm and they had not been to service.I called the operator and they said it was because they were busy but they would let them know to service my room next.I told them I would call back for service as my baby Grandson was about to take a nap after being out all day.Ten minutes later the maid knocked and walked in (no communication) I told her to just give me coffee. The next morning was my check out day (Check out was 12) The maid knocked and walked in I told her we were checking out that day (it was only 8 am) She did the same at 10 am normally they would wait till you had checked out but this housekeeping were obviously not intouch with what was going on. I have worked in Hospitality and realised the service lacked big time at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The Westin San Diego - Beyond the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: LeapinLina
Reviews.Content: I was a meeting planner for my company's market development 2-day workshop last February. We had never partnered with this venue before so I was a little hesitant due to the lack of history/relationship. My company has a tendency to make numerous last minute changes and I wondered how they would rise to the occasion. My apprehensions were abated the minute I began working with the staff there. From start to finish, they anticipated our every need, were always proactive in their approach, resolved conflicts and were overall an excellent team to work with. Not to mention that the room rate and value of service were top notch. Kudos to the BEO team, Randy and Daniel, who went beyond the call of duty. I found them professional and extremely accommodating but most importantly, personable. I felt like I left the hotel with new friends. I would highly recommend this venue as location for your next company event/meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, but...”
Reviews.Author: vacyclist27
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had stayed at this Westin. The room was beautiful and had great views of the harbor. The front desk staff were very friendly and professional.The in-room coffee was Starbucks and good, the coffee bar coffee was also Starbucks and not so good. The cost for internet access was outrageous, thankfully they did not charge for printing out the boarding passes. The reception on the television was spotty and most of the major networks did not come in clearly ( we made a complaint, but the issue was not completely resolved) The shower was really nice. the bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. Overall, I enjoyed my stay, but it was not a bargain, and I really resent being charged a lot for the room and then an outrageous amount for internet. thankfully I had my smartphone with me.

Reviews.Title: “Service was lacking to non-existent”
Reviews.Author: Jclassvan
Reviews.Content: Booked the Westin for an overnight stay because of it's close proximity to the Amtrak station two blocks away. Arrived and had to park about 1/2 block away as the entrance area was filled with valet parked vehicles. Bell person suggested that I check in first and then he would look after the luggage. The person who checked me in really didn't seem that he wanted to be working there. My first impression was that I was a bother to him rather than a customer. Having just come from a fabulous week at the Westin in Palm Desert, the first impression here was a real let down. I confirmed that the room that I had booked had two queen beds. Nope he said - all we have are two doubles. I asked if they did not have two queens and he just said "nope". How many keys do you want was the next question. I asked for two. When we got to the room there was only one in the folder. So much for paying attention to my answer. I went back out to the vehicle and my wife and kids had unloaded the luggage on to the sidewalk. The bell person was just standing there looking around, so I grabbed a luggage cart and started to push it down the sidewalk. That got his attention and he finally came to help. With the luggage unloaded I headed to the airport to drop our rental vehicle off. Went into the terminal and called the Westin for a pickup in their van. Will be there in 15 minutes was the reply. I waited 25 minutes and finally called again. No one seemed to know about my request and said that once I had my luggage I should call and they would come. I told the operator on the phone that I had already been waiting for 25 minutes from my first call. Sorry she said, we will be there within 20 minutes. I waited 20 minutes (now 45 in total) and gave up and grabbed a cab. When I got back to the hotel, the van was still parked in front and had not even moved. Went up to the room and my wife thought that it was housekeeping. She had called and asked for a couple of blankets and extra towels. Shortly after we left for dinner with friends for a couple of hours. When we got back to the room there still were no towels or blankets. She phoned again and it took over half an hour for them to arrive. I won't comment much on the room, except to say that the angle of the outside wall made things fairly tight with four people and luggage in the room. Room was okay - a standard hotel room - nothing special. Definitely has been renovated at some point in the past, but not a great renovation to say the least. Between business and leisure I spend at least 60 nights per year in hotel rooms and this had to be the worst service that I have had in the last three years.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Staceyzig
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our one year old daughter stayed 6 nights at this Westin. The hotel was beautiful the staff were very helpful. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Read my feedback”
Reviews.Author: CRCU
Reviews.Content: The Pors: The welcome at the lobby was very nice, what you would expect for a high priced accomodation. The room was clean and well kept. The staff are very polite and accomodating. The Cons: The Internet was expensive and wi-fi was problematic at best. Includes conference rooms. Called in for troubleshooting and was transferred to a toll free number but the call was charged to my room even though it is the Hotel's issue. Not advisable for business trips where you need to be connected the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AllysonSacko
Reviews.Content: Dear Mr. Beaton, From start to finish The Westin San Diego provided amazing service. The entire staff is incredible, from the shuttle, front desk, sales, catering, reservations and banquets they all worked so well together without hesitation. Paul Lotz was patient and attentive throughout the entire event, Diane, Baron, Randy, Roman, Mohammad and Pedro in banquets NEVER missed a thing they were all extremely customer driven. Chef even came down and provided me with a recipe, what a guy. Ray made sure every day we had all of our AV needs met and then some. Jose helped make sure all of our packages were delivered and rooms were set up to our satisfaction. Caroline in reservations worked well to ensure all necessary reservations were in place. My expectations are high when traveling, but I have to say the staff at the Westin is five star in my book and exceeded my expectations. Thank you for a wonderful event from start to finish I did not have to worry about a thing because your staff had it covered. It was a wonderful experience and I would do it all over again. Respectfully, Allyson Rollins, ICMI Training Operations Manager

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: pharmgirl1966
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was within walking distance of many good restaurants, the Gaslamp Quarter, Seaport Village, and the Midway museum. Unlike other reviewers, we had plenty of hot water and no noise. We stayed over a Thursday night, which happened to be St. Patrick's Day. Our stay was quiet and relaxing inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in freebies”
Reviews.Author: lakotamom
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed to find that internet access was not included in my room rate. I've stayed at other hotels where this was treated just like the TV or phone. Since internet use is so widespread, I feel that it should be standard with all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Construction across the street, noisy hotel room, disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jpetrone
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and stay at a lot of hotels. I was disappointed in the fact how noisy the room was and the distance to the Gas Lamp district, the fact you pay $32 a day for valet parking which really is the only option. Though a garage is right there you pay $28 a day so for $4.00 more, why wouldn't you valet? Other than that the room was a nice size with a decent sized bathroom. The hotel was clean. We did order room service one night and it was good. They thanked us about 20 times for using them. (obviously very few people do.) If I had to do it over again, I wouldn't have stayed here based on location. If I had to be in area, it wouldn't be a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not for young families”
Reviews.Author: itrvl4work
Reviews.Content: Booked well in advance for part of our family vacation as I am Starwood Gold and have enjoyed staying at Starwood hotels in the past for vacations and business. The room we were in was small, partially because we had 2 doubles. Asked for a larger room but none available, even with SPG Gold. Noticed that the fridge was removed. Asked for one but none available...only for medical emergencies. Never heard that before. If you have young children and need to keep milk or snacks in a fridge, this isn't the place to stay. The desk lamp was broken, shade was hanging off to one side, not sure how housekeeping could miss this! Internet for a fee, still not sure why hotels are charging for this. Did they ever charge for TVs thirty years ago? Service was great, bellman, valet, front desk were all very friendly and helpful. When I called to speak to the manager, he however was not very understanding and just gave me the canned response about the fridge and how most rooms were the same size as ours. Our closet door was next to the bed and about 12" away, and we did not have any room for our luggage. One bag had to sit on the armchair/ottoman. Ours had the long narrow cooridor at the entrance and most of the other rooms did not. When I booked (at least one month prior) I mentioned we were a family of four. I would have thought they would have put us in a larger room. Valet was a little expensive, about $30 a day, but this is downtown SD and the lot next door is $25 a day but no in-out privileges so not too bad. They don't have the $5 coupon if you opt out of housekeeping. They did not have the typical tourist magazines in the room like other hotels. Since we were on vacation, it would have been nice to have these. Front desk was helpful and brought some up to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: lannie63
Reviews.Content: Convenient location and very helpful staff. Sophie, the concierge, was very cheerdul, helpful and efficient in suggesting places to dine. Thanks Sophie!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Flyboy22
Reviews.Content: I was offered a Starwood room and it was larger and nicer than the lower floor rooms, I turned it down and took a lesser room with a bay view a few floors down. I think I should have stayed in the higher room with a view of the construction across the street as it had a better layout and more room with two chairs and a table. The room I settled in had only one chair and was very small. The bed was comfortable, however the sheets were rough. I had them changed once during our stay and the second set was better but still rough. Hotel shuttle was going to be a 28 minute wait for the ride to the airport so I took a cab for $12 to make sure made my flight. Not too happy about that. Cab to the Zoo was about $10 to $12 and only took about 5 minutes or less. Walking to the gas lamp district was 15 minutes to the far end or so. A couple or few blocks to several places to eat and see. About 4 or 5 blocks down to the water and the Midway aircraft carrier and the maritime museum. Happy hour at the bar is really a good deal. $5 well drinks and $5 appetizers that are more than just little things, really good for the money. Nice bar area to sit in and talk or watch TV. Starbucks has the basic coffee, juice and baked goods, etc. in the lobby. The restaurant was dead every time I looked in and had a repellent feel that made me not want to eat there. In the same building is the Emerald Cafe which has simple sandwiches and other plastic plate type cafe stuff. About one block North is the Carl Strauss Brew Pub which as some good beer and higher end brewpub food, very good and comfortable. Bathroom was small but clean and functional and lots of hot water, clean towels and toiletries. Housekeeping service was excellent. I talked with and received excellent service and advice that made our trip better from three different concierge staff. All excellent friendly, approachable and knowledgeable with good food and destination ideas and public transit information.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: mreali22
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience. Everyone was so friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you dont mind walking a bit”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: There are 2 westin's at SD. This is the one in Broadway. The entrance to the hotel is on the side street and not from Broadway. Hotel valet is $32 but parking garage across the street is $12. A tip. Unless you are driving to SD dont bother renting a car. Hotel offers free shuttle to and from airport and cab ride is 10 bucks. Hotel is part hotel and part office. That was a bit of a strange thing. We were there for a conference. The rooms were not bad. Nothing great but nothing much to complain about. We got the conference rate of $159 per room so were happy about that. The main problem with this hotel is that if you want to go into the action of things then its a 10-15 minute walk. Not bad if you are up for a walk. All the action is on 4th and 5th. Next time I will try the Westin Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin San Diego is a beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PeteFeddersen
Reviews.Content: The personnel were friendly and very helpful. I especially like the "Roast beef dip" for lunch and the Starbucks in the lobby. Their Breakfast burritos are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MemberTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a combination business and pleasure trip: Leisure Thursday and Friday and a conference at the hotel over the weekend. Our king bedroom was very clean and had a very comfortable bed and linens, fluffy and abundant towels, nice amenities and a comfy bathrobe too. Big bathroom, good water pressure with dual shower heads was a nice touch. Temperature control was perfect. We had one of their smaller king rooms, but it was still very comfortable and roomy enough, and we got a great rate so we had no complaints. It was convenient to the Gaslamp district and mall shopping. The convention room equipment worked flawlessly (from what I could tell) and had comfortable chairs. Starbucks coffee was offered during breaks. Valet parking cost $30/day with in/out priviledges, and the valet staff was quick to bring our car around. There's a surcharge for in-room wifi access, so we used our own wireless card. Overall a great stay and we'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was so friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: kodiban
Reviews.Content: Concierge Molly was super! She helped us find our way around, printed out boarding passes and anything needed. The gentleman who picked us up on 3/2 (around 1:00PM) was terrific. He helped answer some logistic questions after we arrived. Sorry, I don't remember his name - (young, dark hair). The hotel was wonderful, although a little pricey for me normally. I had to pay for the first 3 nights, my company paid the next 4. But, I would say it was worth the price, I just normally can't afford these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: lisafloth
Reviews.Content: It was my boyfriend's 40th Birthday and the hotel was aware of this. On our first night, they sent up a bottle up champagne and strawberries. It was wonderful and he was so surprised. The service was excellent. The Valet Attendents always remembered us... I thank the hotel staff for making our trip such a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: adhland
Reviews.Content: Of the four gaslamp hotels I've ever occupied, I like this one the best.. The location is great and the room was great. I had a 12th floor room with a corner view and the bed may be the most comfortable I've ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boxofcrayons
Reviews.Content: The Westin was perfectly nice. I had read other reviews critical of the hotel, but did not find any of those issues during my stay. The conference facilities were convenient and well attended by hotel staff. The room was large and even had a partial view of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location even better Concierge”
Reviews.Author: capecodsailor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. got in late so we missed the last shuttle to the hotel. Front desk was very helpful and got us to hotel. then gave us free internet and breakfast on first day. Room was on 23rd floor great views. Court house being built across the street so sleeping in is not an option. Lobby Bar was nice. Bartender very friendly(melissa?) But best of all was the help we got from Molly and Andrew at the Concierge Desk! Our trip was a xmas gift to the kids Molly sent me photos of the hotel in advance to put in the kids gifts. Then She sent milk and cookies to the room, They both gave us great advice on places to go and things to see. They made our trip a great success! Rooms were clean and hotel in central location You dont need to rent a car if you are staying here. Warning the Gaslamp District is not for kids after dark IMO. THANK YOU MOLLY and ANDREW you made our week!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: SusanLau
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Comfortable bed. Couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing service level, 50% staff are not motivated”
Reviews.Author: Mark1111111
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that it's fine hotel in general, I'm afraid that everything is too much asked in this hotel. This is not an exception to ay rule, I have had multiple moments of genuinely shown disinterest in me as a customer and guest form multiple staff members, leading me to believe that there is a management problem here. Although some incident are smaler than others, I just noted them because they are exemplary. 1. on entering the BF room, 2 staff members were chatting away. One literally with his hands in his pockets like he had nothing else to do. 2. We entered the buffet area at 8.30am on a weekend. Missing was: bread (really), Plain yoghurt (empty and not available anymore), pancakes (empty), butter (really). I noticed this one at a time and asked for these one at a time. Staff hadn't even noticed it before I asked. Once I got to the bread (4th item missing) I exploded and threatened to file a complaint. Suddenly, everything changed, I got my yoghurt which miracolously was found, we were given a extremely good service, which we enjoyed and thanked for and which is how it should've been in the 1st place. The guy with his hands in his pocket, who had earlier said "There were so many guest, you guys cleaned out all the food in this place"(really! those awful guests!) was suddenly helping out too. Just to be clear, I don't mind if something is missign or goes wrong (if it is not too much!) but what I do mind is a total lack of commitment to make things work in the first place. 2. The concierge was keeping it deliberately short to help other guests (understandable, but wrong in my humbel opinion because he made me feel less important than the guest waiting behind me), instead of answering my questions, which were not beyond anything normal a tourist would ask 3. When asked for quarters for the parking meter, I got 4 from a new rol or quarters (really). I asked for more, but he said he needed them in case more customers asked. When I said, that maybe they should stock for more quarters in a centrum district with paid parking, the atmosphere chilled to an unprofessional level, especially in a 4 star hotel. Pro's: valet parking guys, technical staff very friendly and helpful. This can be good hotel, but staff needs to be motivated and some things are simply at a 2 star level, nothing exaggarated.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip - a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Annecaz
Reviews.Content: The Westin made my San Diego Conference trip a pleasure. So comfortable and restful! The bed was incredible. There was a plush bathrobe in the bath and internet access in the room. The Lounge had great tasty treats and service was friendly and courteous. I loved the complementary fruit flavored water in the lobby, on tap... Nice touch. All around great experience.

Reviews.Title: “In need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Elisio
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Diego has a good location downtown. The beds are good. However it is in urgent need of refurbishment. Bathrooms are very old and rather dirty. Very small bath, no separate shower stalls. Room interior old fashioned. Probably there has been a minibar, but now there is a cupboard with a big hole. The bathrobe was very dirty. One of the sleeves was even black on the inside. Curtains were not opening on one day, bath tap was leaking, the other day the room was not cleaned. The things were solved, but there was no sorry or regret or whatever sign of care or hospitality at all. The concierges were kind. None of the other employees was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ Westin SD”
Reviews.Author: Gdenver
Reviews.Content: Our stay @ the Westin was great for the hotel staff was so nice and friendly and they allow us to check in to our room @ 9:00 am when we arrived in to town. Great location for the many museums, gas lamp dist., little Italy, and Baloba Park. We were able to walk everywhere. AAA+++ Vin De Syrah!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D32Chicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating. There was a slight mix up with the complimentary airport shuttel- it was quickly rectified. Complimentary afternoon snacks were sent to the room due to the mix up. Room was very clean- beds were extremely comfortable and the staff was great. Will definitely return to this hotel when returning to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not good experience”
Reviews.Author: klroger
Reviews.Content: The location and the acomodations were excellent. However, on both consecutive nights, the first on arrival and the second night that I was there, the cards to enter my room did not work, forcing me to wait on security while other residents looked at me as if saying what are you doing just hanging around here (are you trying to steak something) ? This was embarassing for me both times. I just don't understand how this could happen two consecutive times. Because of this, O.K. the first time, right after getting the cards, neither worked - I agree mistakes happen. But to happen again on the very next night - unforgiveable. I will not be visitign any more Westin Hotels, and will counsel my friends to do likewise if other options are availble. Thanks, Keith L. Rogers, Ph.D. Microelectronics Reliability Engineer Functional and Physical Analysis Division Supervisor Department of Defense Fort Meade, MD 240-373-2982

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: petergn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel so that I could attend a conference at the San Diego Conference Center. The Conference Ctr is about a mile away and within walking distance as each day I was there the weather was a pleasant 68-70 in the morning. The hotel is also within walking distance to the Gaslamp district and such tourist spots as the ships Midway and Star of India. My only issue was that when I asked to stay an extra half day (because my rertun flight wasn't until 9:30pm). The next morning, my bill was under my door, but did not reflect the extra half day charge. I spoke with the front desk and they advised that they would have a new bill made at my convenience. However, later that afternoon, upon return from a walk (I was gone from 1-5pm) my room key did not work, so once again I needed to return to the front desk. That was disaapointing as I had asked a full day ahead of time. While asking to stay for an additional half day (and I paid for it) may be a little out of the usual, once the request was made, the morning bill should have reflected the additional charge without requiring follow up by the patron. When it was reported by the patron that the bill hadn't been updated, the front desk should have also checked to make certain the key check out time was extended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place unless you want a hot shower”
Reviews.Author: kanutecarson
Reviews.Content: I only had lukewarm water for my entire stay. Thought is was a fluke on day one, and did not complain. Same problem on the next morning. Had four rooms total for my business and two had hot water and two did not. Complained when leaving and they did comp the overpriced parking fee. Still a little disappointed for Westin.

Reviews.Title: “you owe me a nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: SFtravelpoet
Reviews.Content: beware!!! i have slept in many noisy cities but did not expect the continuing onslaught of noise at this hotel in downtown SD. most important - construction across the street STARTS at 7AM. this is not the hotel's fault but if i were running this hotel i would have some serious issues with the city allowing construction to start at this hour. on an ongoing basis - train whistles throughout the night and a horn from a ship (cruise ship docking?) at 2A. this isn't just street noise (cars, buses, garbage pickup) this is very loud and potentially manageable - it just isn't being done.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fair, stay away from guest store!”
Reviews.Author: k4beanumite
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was "okay" and the service was good to be fair. I did, however, witness quite a distributing event in the hotel gift shop wherein the attendance, "Dana" was quite rude/boarerline racisit to a Chinese guest whose name I will leave off of this. I filed a complaint with the hotel and never heard back. I will not be staying here again as a result and will take my business to the US Grand-- just up the street, on par with cost and far superior in accomodations/food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: PTravelRichmond_VA
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but had excellent service from the minute we drove up. The guy that took our luggage also came in and printed out airline boarding passes for us. I wish I had written his name down. The person checking us in also was very nice and gave us a room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MTRoamer
Reviews.Content: Check in was not great, room required repairs (broken light, plugged tub, filthy ironing board with non-working iron). I was not thrilled with the overall quality of the hotel. Even the bar/lounge was too small for such a big hotel and REALLY slow service.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT experience!”
Reviews.Author: KJBoroughs
Reviews.Content: Our trip to San Diego was abolutely fabulous and a great deal of that was due to the first person we met there. Jesse Melton, driver, bell-hop, all round super employee made our stay in San Diego one to remember. He sincerely took the time to listen to our questions and issues and solved them! He was extremely congenial and well mannered, well versed on his city and did a fantastic job of making us feel appreciated and welcome in San Diego. Every city should have people like Jesse working for them. The WORLD would be a much better place! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: oceanpaula
Reviews.Content: I liked the beds I was disappointed because they had construction going on outside and it was a bit noisy and when I went to have coffee out at the pool we could not go out there because they were washing windows. My sister also said she had problems with the shower staying warm. The hotel is in a great location and it was very clean but I was disappointed that I was not told about the construction going on or I would have gone elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Easy and nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Kompring
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin for 2 nights. Clean, nice and very comforable room. The Concierge-Sofie Bundy- was very helpful andvising and in particular finding an excellent restaurant in the last minute for our tem - perfect table and perfect food choices. Great treadmills in the gym also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Diego (the one at 400 Broadway) is very nice. Nice rooms, nice central location. Little bit of a walk from the convention center, but doable in about 15+ minutes walking. Hotel was clean and pleasant staff all around. Only complaints. 1) Parking at the hotel is $32/night. I've mentioned in other reviews that parking fees irritate me, even though this one was for valet, I find $32 a night excessive, especially when I'm staying at the hotel. 2) I had a room on the south side of the building, facing Broadway, and they are building a new court house across the street. The Ironworkers start work around 6:30am, so if you have the opportunity to sleep in it will be disrupted by construciton noise. I'd choose a room facing the other direction next time. 3) No free internet. This is almost a commodity these days, so I think they should offer it free, like most other hotels in this class All in all a very nice hotel. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good people”
Reviews.Author: DenseandDave
Reviews.Content: Your front desk people, concierges, drivers and one of the bartenders were first rate. Friendly, helpful and professional. People like that make all the difference when we choose a place to stay. Thank them for us

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect - Great Staff but Management need to solve one thing”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: As per all of the other reviews - this is a Hotel which really understands customer service and backs it up - failing one small but important thing. Hot water temperature - while I understand the standard that you do not wish to scald anyone - for us bathers, the water temperature setting is not high enough. When your teeth are chattering as you try and have a soak in the tub - but there isnt enough warmth - that's a problem. Even the nicely trained maintenance staff didnt get it. So to the Hotel GM and Chief Engineer - please do me a favor and check in to one of your rooms and run yourself a bath - get in it and see if it is hot enough for you to enjoy it and relax a little. Nope - you will be quite chilly...too bad

Reviews.Title: “Who says you can't improve Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Laura60638
Reviews.Content: I have never slept better in my life! Especially in a hotel! Don't have a single complaint. Everything was perfect and everyone was pleasant and helpful. Thank you for a wonderful stay in your Pardise in Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall service especially from the Concierage”
Reviews.Author: Melvin56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I was in town for a conference from January 7 - 13, 2011. I truly can say this is the best overall experience I've had at a hotel in my travels. From the time I was picked up by their complimentary hotel shuttle to the time I checked out the service was great. I used the Concierage service many times and all of the people who I encountered gave me great service and info, but there was one employee who worked at the Concierage desk that provided me with "outstanding" service and also went beyond the normal call of duty. Her name is Sopia. I dealt with her more than anyone else, but that is not why I'm writing this review. It's because of the extra things she did to accomodate me for my dining needs. I asked her about places to eat on several occasions and each time not only did she suggest a nice place, she volunteered to make the reservations. My last night there I told her I wanted to go to Coronado Island for dinner. It's across the bay from San Diego and I was taking the ferry. She suggested a restaurant named "Peohe's" that sits on the water and has an fantastic view of the San Diego skyline. She suggested if I got there by 5:30 pm I should be able to get a window view table. She told me she would call and make the reservation. Well she did make the reservation but did much more than that. Unbeknowing to me she asked the restaurant not only to seat me at a window table with a marvelous view of San Diego she also asked them to give me VIP service. When I arrived they seated me at a table with a breathtaking view of San Diego placed a vase of fresh flowers on my table and gave me a personalized menu that had a welcome to the restaurant from Sophia of the Westin welcoming my party with my last name on it. This was truly a nice touch & something that has never happened to me before. But it didn't end there the waiter informed me that Sophia would like to buy me an dessert on her after my meal if I so inclined. I was really surprised to say the least. She went far beyond her normal duty to make my dining experience a truly memorable one. I also must admit the dinner at the restaurant Peohe's was excellent and was the best meal I had during my visit to San Diego. Not only did she have a wonderful spirit she was a great person, with great insight. My visit at this hotel goes to the top of my list and I would recommend anyone to stay there. The location was great and accessible to everything you would like to do. I will definitely stay here the next time I'm in San Diego and suggest you should too. You would not be disappointed. I tip my hat to the staff of the Westin San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience. Would definately stay again.”
Reviews.Author: karenTemecula
Reviews.Content: Michelle, at the front desk gave us a very nice greeting. She is an excellant representative for your company. She was very cheerful and helpful. However I do not know how she does her work so well, as the front desk counter area was FREEZING! We couldn't wait to get away from that area. It was not in keeping with the rest of the warm reception. Michelle didn't complain, but I certainly couldn't have done my job well, under those conditions. I would suggest some form of heating in that area. Our room and bathroom was large, spotless and inviting. The bed very comfortable with nice linens. The veiw was beautiful. The breakfast roomservice was the fastest we'd ever experienced ANYWHERE, and the food was delicious and reasonably priced. Overall, a great stay which we will be happy to repeat. Thank you, Ron and Karen

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tntpdx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights while attending an association conference. The service was EXCELLENT. From the courtesy shuttle pick up from the airport to housekeeping to checkout, the staff is top notch. Shuttle driver Michael was extremely friendly and offered tips for getting around to my meeting sites and the convention center. Front desk were on top of everything getting and the concierge and bell staff were prompt and very professional. Everyone was so friendly and accommodating! The very definition of hospitality. The price was at the higher end of my budget and hotel charges for Internet and parking were also more expensive than I'm used to, but overall, my stay was great!

Reviews.Title: “Randy Rivers was great to work with!”
Reviews.Author: nancy751
Reviews.Content: Randy Rivers, the Banquet Manager, was fantastic to work with. He has an exceptional attitude. If you are planning a meeting at this hotel you should ask for Randy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Attention to Customer Servie”
Reviews.Author: gratefulLakewood
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about my recent stay at the Westin. I was so impressed with the quality of their service. We were greeted by a wonderful front desk employee Reham. She was so friendly and went out of her way to make us feel welcome. We arrived a bit early and she found us a room right away so we could relax a bit. In addition she checked on us to make sure we had everything we needed. I also wanted to thank another employee Jeanine Benson who supervised the bar/lounge she was very sweet and attentive to our needs and refused a tip for her efforts. The Westin should be proud to have such caring and competent employees. The room was also very comfortable and clean. The only noise we heard was a few sirens outside no noise from any neighbors. I have stayed at many hotels and am a Marriott vacation owner and continue to be impressed with the quality of the Westin's especially this hotel We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “They actually ASK for mentions on TripAdvisor!”
Reviews.Author: aussiesseetheworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK...it's in a good location and the rooms are fine, however, internet connection is expensive and there is no bar fridge. What bothered us though was the lack of authenticity among staff. The service at the front desk was haphazard...if the staff there weren't talking amongst themselves or busy at the computer, they occasionally raised their head to serve us...but more often than not we waited for their attention. So much for four star service. Although the breakfast buffet was OK, we absolutely hated it when the wait staff came up to us at the end of our meal and gave us a card with their names on it. Text on the back of the card explained that if we mentioned the server by name on TripAdvisor, they'd get a bonus from their employer, Westin Hotels. They directly asked us to write a positive personal review on this site. Sorry guys, but that's not how it works in our books. First you want a tip for a breakfast buffet...where guests serve themselves...and THEN you overtly ask for free advertising and more perks? Having stayed in hundreds of hotels over the years, I have never seen anything so tacky. I'm not sure where pride in doing a good job, a positive customer service ethic and professionalism comes in - but at the Westin San Diego, the staff''s 'it's all about me' attitude ensured that the guest always came second during our stay. I am surprised that a well known brand like the Westin encourages this practice, which is not in keeping with the subtle but excellent service standards of its competitors. If you want to be treated like a valued guest...stay somewhere else in downtown San Diego. There are plenty of hotels nearby where your custom will be appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Was hoping for a perfect experience, but didn't pan out as hoped”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix_AZMkim
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was OKAY, not fantastic though. Our connecting room was not ready when we checked in close to 4pm. I called a week before our arrival to make sure that rooms would be ready because we were traveling a long way with two small children. I was assured that rooms would be ready, but they were not. Our front desk person was not very kind either. He was indifferent to my frustrations and did not offer any suggestions other than to sit and wait. He also told us that the rooms would be ready in about an hour, but they were ready 10 minutes after he told us it would be an hour. I'm glad that we decided to wait in the lobby and not leave the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, which made things better. However, there was no mini bar frig, as advertised, and the television channels were terrible. We had to BUY kid appropriate television programs for my children. We went to the restaurant for breakfast on both mornings of our stay and the service and food was terrible. The host, manager and servers were completely unaware that there were guests in the restaurant. We had to actually get up and make a request for a server on several occasions. The food on the buffet was cold, stale and unappetizing. My husband and I ended up ordering off the menu on the second morning. We also had dinner in the hotel and that experience was much better. Our server was very attentive and the food was okay. This is the second Westin I've been to and both experiences have not been good. I don't think I'll stay in another Westin property. It looks great in the advertisements, but once you actually get there it's a totally different situation.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: nedgulden
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a pre-cruise hotel before Christmas and must admit I was disappointed. The hotel is nothing special, the rooms are just Ok. It has a cold, 'basic business hotel' feel to it. The staff are pleasant and the location is Ok but in future I'd stay at the US Grant which is only 1 1/2 blocks away and is a 'cosier' hotel. For a Business hotel they don't even offer free internet (not even for SPG members!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bartelprint2
Reviews.Content: Breakfast Buffet is WAY TO EXPENSIVE!! Breafast meats were dried out and we had to ask for our eggs anyway we wanted them instead of the waitress asking us if we wanted any eggs or waffles!! incredible staff except for the waitress at the Breakfast Buffet

Reviews.Title: “It was my most satisfy stay in the Westin Brand with my recent stays.”
Reviews.Author: funjlee2010
Reviews.Content: I appreciate my stay with this Westin to bring me more positive experience in the SPG program due to recent stays in other properties in Starwood Hotels. Through this stay in this hotel, it brings me back my confiendent to the royal program as well because I was almost to think about the program is no longer to be royality on it since the program going down badly with my recent stays with other properies due to lacking of services and qualities offered to the Elite members. However, the Westin Hotel in San Diego brought me back a confiendent to believe that I am seeing bright future of the program again. I appreciate the stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you can stay anywhere, choose ONLY a Westin Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Silverfoxguy50
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this Westin during a conference a few months ago and found everything at this hotel to be exceptional - service, quality, cleanliness and value. It is in a great location and the staff have consistently been customer-service oriented. Recently, on two separate occasions, I had chosen to stay at a Hilton hotel and both times, the service was less than good and I felt like I was being "nickeled and dimed" by the facilities. After experiencing the Westin, I have vowed that whenever I have the choice between a Hilton and a Westin, I will consistently select a Westin Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the San Diego Westin”
Reviews.Author: great12346
Reviews.Content: The front desk upgraded me to a bay view room upon arrival. The room and view was amazing. Melissa at the bar was amazing and made a great apple martini. I ate at the restaurant and had the Steak Oscar that was delicious. Our server, Theresa was great with her service and attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service at the Westin San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kimimacCA
Reviews.Content: Our Marketing team recently planned a 2-day offsite staff meeting, and selected the Westin San Diego as our location. Jen Cease, Convention Services Manager, was the consummate professional, answering question after question with patience and cheerfulness. Molly Moran, Concierge, provided fantastic service!! She was always friendly, helpful and prompt in responding to our needs. She went above and beyond in service to our team. Jen, Molly and the entire Westin San Diego team helped make our Marketing staff meeting a complete success. We'd return in a minute!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from Events Staff”
Reviews.Author: KevinTheGreat
Reviews.Content: My company recently held a half-day seminar at the Westin and we had great support from Randy Rivers, Mark Reiter, and the rest of the banquet/events staff. Will definitely return if we host another seminar in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Westin!”
Reviews.Author: fit4aking
Reviews.Content: The entire staff at The Westin San Diego is excellent. Everyone is so friendly and willing to help. Big thanks to Stephen Kelly at the front desk for making my arrival experience so wonderful. You set the tone for my whole trip. I will be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: charley247
Reviews.Content: It was a weekend get-away and because of the wonderful concierge service, we had a wonderful time during the stay. Not only did she recommend a restaurant but took the time out to print out a map, go over directions and made reservations for us. It was great weekend. I certainly recommend this Westin! The only thing that didn't go so well was ironing. The iron was completely broken but we ran out of time so didn't get a replacement.

Reviews.Title: “The bartender, Mark Drahuschak was great!”
Reviews.Author: gingertate
Reviews.Content: Being from a small town in New Mexico I drink Dr Pepper, even with my rum. The bar did not have rum but Mark had a Dr Pepper of his own and actually opened it for me so I could have my usual drink. He saved me after the long fast paced day I had just spent. He was great. Thank you Mark, Ginger

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected happiness / Presidential suite- wow”
Reviews.Author: gen96
Reviews.Content: We had another place in mind at first but canceled and chose here. It was our unexpected happiness. We drove from N. California and had family in the Poway area. We wanted a clean and relaxing place from it all. This was it. But our booking company was misinformed of the parking situation here. We almost wanted to leave. But thankfully Mr. Luke Profancik help clear the matter up. Street parking is free at certain hours of the evening. Just follow the signs. Then a Mr. Rob Glaus continued our check in. He helped us learn the area and made our little ones happy with free kids "exploring" bags. Imagine our surprise, a hotel in this area thinking of our kids. Then another gentlemen (he wore a double button uniform like a bell boy,sorry no name )came to us with a holiday game. Our prize was a free luxury suite upgrade. Wow. The only suite left was the presidential suite - like they would give that to us. But Mr. Rob Glaus did. The suite like the hotel was immaculate & relaxing. Even if we had our original room which was the guest room in that suite - it would have been more than enough. Thank you to the whole team for putting this mom at ease after a stressful beginning. When we come back to visit our family again we know exactly where to stay. Great location, views, hotel , and Staff. We already recommended this to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “First Negative Comments I've Made Regarding a Hotel Stay All Year”
Reviews.Author: Les2302
Reviews.Content: There was nothing in particular that stood out to cause me to comment that I won't stay at The Westin again; but rather several small things. I wondered about The Westin as I first took the elevator to my room. A group of business ladies commented that they would not stay here again. Before I begin on the negative issues, I would like to report that the Valet personnel were excellent. Though I usually don't use this option, I found all Valet personnel to be friendly, courteous and professional. Most hotels I stay at will ask in advance how many pillows I would like and do I prefer foam or feather. This was not done at your hotel. I felt that the maid must have been ordered to carefully look at the lotion and shampoo bottles to see if a drop could be squeezed out. 4 days with two of us in the room and the lotion and shampoo was never replaced. Towels and wash clothes that had been placed on the side of the tub were left by the maid. Though she did replace them, I didn't understand why she left them. The room usually wasn't made up until mid-afternoon and to be honest, the first day when I returned to my room, I didn't think the maid had been there yet because the bed appeared to be unmade. I then realized she had been in the room, she just didn't do a very good job at making the bed. My wife had left for a run while the made was in the room and when she returned she found that the maid had turned off the A/C. Since it was a fairly warm day in San Diego, she felt this was inappropriate. On our second day, we found that our keys were inoperative when we returned to our room in the early evening. Upon going to the front desk, we were told that they had to reset all the keys. If this was the case, I would have expected someone to have been by the elevators, informing guests of this before they ventured 23 floors up. The front desk clerk didn't offer an apology for the inconvenience. The workout room was very much like a sauna. I was in the gym at 0530 every morning and by 0545 I could see that I wasn't the only one sweating profusely. As I mentioned, I typically send out positive comments and I really don't like reporting on negative experiences, however; I hope that you will consider my comments and make some of the small changes that I feel are necesary. Thanks, Les

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: downtownM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great "staycation" night away from the kids. We went out downtown and enjoyed the location of the Westin. The staff was great and Juan Verduzco was a very entertaining waiter in the restaurant during breakfast. We enjoyed great service! Here's a tip, try out one of their many neat "package" deals. We did the shopping one and received a $50 gift card for shopping, two cocktails and an appetizer to power our shopping. There are many other fun packages.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JanWeisman
