Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: kentmedwards
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at the SHRM conference in San Diego and really enjoyed our stay at the Westin San Diego. And the gracious attention of our concierge Sofie truly made it special. She worked with us to arrange day activities for my wife to enjoy, and made dinner reservations for us each evening. All of her recommendations were perfect. Because my wife's a foodie with a real passion for cooking, Sofie was even able to arrange for a kitchen tour by the chef at Bertrand at Mister A's, itself an amazing dining experience! Wonderful food, wines and killer views! (Be sure to add this to your must-have restaurant list!) We'd definitely return to the city and to the hotel, and would eagerly put ourselves in the hands of the wonderful Sofie once again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: seanko99
Reviews.Content: When staying at the Westin San Diego we frequented the restaurant on the first floor for breakfast. Our regular server, Kelly Norton, supplied the service and positive attitude that we needed to start our day on the right foot. She left me a positive view of the restaurant and hotel and I'll be sure to stop by and get the delicious oatmeal the next time in town. If you run into her, be sure to compliment her on her "weight boarding" skills.

Reviews.Title: “Michelle was great”
Reviews.Author: rob918
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip.........Took Amtrak from Pasadena to San Diego and the hotel is only about one block away from the train station. We were greeted by Michelle who works the front desk. She was very helpful and pleasant during our stay. We also utilized the restaurant for breakfast and the service was very good. I would come back to this Westin and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Employee: Juan Verduzco Jr.”
Reviews.Author: andreajcorbett
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much to Juan for making my solo trips to the hotel restaurant for breakfast such a delight. He was attentive and engaging and I enjoyed hearing about how he was planning to enjoy his family for the July 4th weekend.

Reviews.Title: “This stay truly was "heavenly"....and the service provided was great!”
Reviews.Author: SMH617
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin during a conference. My spouse came along, so we stayed four extra nights to do some San Diego site-seeing. The bed was super comfortable...it's hard to find a bed as comfortable as ours at home! Loved the double-headed shower! The service was great....Bertha kept our room clean and tidy, and gave those extra touches. We had an internet connection problem one night, and Andres came up to our room, corrected the issue, and was polite and helpful. The shuttle drivers were so kind and courteous. The only thing better would be free internet. Overall, though, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Never used thier Heavenly bed, slept on the floor,”
Reviews.Author: buenhec
Reviews.Content: I will have to say, the hotel is beautiful in a great location and in good shape. I traveled with my spouse and two kids. I had reserved a room with double beds so that each of us could sleep with one of our twins. We were given a single king bed. There were no cribs or roll away beds available and we got the last set of sheets in the entire hotel which didnt do much to make a makeshift bed on the floor. Since the four of us would not fit in the bed (we tried) I took the floor which was hard and cold. The next night after being very persistent I was given an extra bed. Needless to say I did not get any sleep the first night. The staff didnt really act concerned and didnt go the extra mile for me. The valet is $32 per night or $24 for self park. Otherwise a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel and outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: azlynnTucson_Arizona
Reviews.Content: As a family traveling with 4 children, we had the most wonderful experience at the Westin San Diego. The staff went above and beyond making our trip enjoyable and a memorable experience (especially Lex Waynick who answered our every question, and we had many). The location is perfect, easy walking distance to the Embaracadero, the mall, shops and dining. The view from our room can't be described, we spent the first hour taking photos of the bay and the sunset. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not a raving review”
Reviews.Author: christie629
Reviews.Content: I booked 6 nights at the Westin as a combo business/pleasure trip. At a convention rate of $249 per night PLUS $32 PER day for the car, and an additional $40 for the internet it was NOT a bargain. When I first checked in I signed up for the weekly internet rate of $40 - I still have trouble with the fact I can get free Wi-Fi at Mcdonalds or Starbucks but at a hotel where I am paying more than $1500 for my stay I don't have free wifi. To make it unberable, it was the slowest internet I've ever experienced since dial up! I tried calling the 800 number which handles their internet and got nowhere. I tried the front desk and as I was explaining the problem and the fact I had already called Tech Service they rudely stopped listening and transferred by call back to overseas tech service. I had to call the front desk TWICE and loudly say "Don't transfer me" just to get them to listen. Very frustrating! Adding to the fact the buttons on the phone for front desk and concerige did not work -- I could not dial out even to call the tech service...I had to use my cell phone. It was a miserable experience. I was there on business for 6 days but could never connect my office effectively unless I took my laptop to the convention center and used the free wifi. The hotel's own front desk staff told me "we've been having problems." Still I had to pay for it. I travel for business often and recreational travel but based on this experience I would NOT reccomend the Westin. This is the first bad review I have given on Trip Advisor...

Reviews.Title: “Kelly Norton in the 400 West Restaurant is awesome.”
Reviews.Author: Bob60811
Reviews.Content: Kelly was attentive, cordial, and had a great personality. She made breakfast a great start to each day she helped us.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Staff is the Best in the Business!!”
Reviews.Author: ATCBAMA
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 weeks at the Westin doing Training for my company and can't say enough good things about our stay. We were treated like rockstars by everyone there. The hotel staff was amazing. I have to give props to the following banquet staff: Santiago Ledezma, Muhammed Chakaneh, Ron Romero, Juan Barquet, Santonio Martinez, Randy Rivers, Barron Meyer and David Rodriguez - You all were so helpful to all of us during our stay. We couldn't have made it without you. You were always accomodating to our request no matter what it was. Also, Ray Nichols with AV was always there when we needed him and made life easy. You greeted us every morning with a bright smile and helped with any request no matter how small. Zue Lima in the restaurant greeted us every morning with a smile and was always helpful and accomodating to our group. I can't leave out Jen Cease - You were amazing!! Thank you for everything! I can't wait for our next trip to San Diego for training!! You all made life away from home a lot more bearable. Thank You All!! Thanks Westin - we miss you already!! Brian McCall AutoTrader.com

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and the front office manager took great care of us.”
Reviews.Author: lesliegallagher1
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room with 2 beds and they didn't have it when we arrived and Stephen Kelly stepped in and made our stay perfect with an upgrade and a roll away bed. I highly recommend this hotel. It was really clean and in a great area. The staff was awsome and handled our situation the way a hotel of this caliber should.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend holding events here!”
Reviews.Author: RBJ00
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations and even better staff! My attendees raved about the food and atmosphere. The staff at the Westin helped make my program a huge success.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...relaxed environment and wake up refreshed and renewed....breathe deep!”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, my allergies were alleviated due to the clean smell of white tea and somehow the pollen from outside was alleviated. The normal rooms are small but tastefully redecorated from when it was a Wyndham. Thedouble shower head was awesome and water pressure made the neck massage a great wakeup call. The elevators were fast and are made of glass. I recommend you definately eat at 400 West. Awesome menu to refuel eier in the morning, afternoon or evening. To belike a native and not what locals call "zonies" (people from the neiboring state of Arizona) ask for Kelly or Lindsay to be your server. Both are excellent and will be so attentive to you. The hostess is Zulema Lopez and looks like Jennifer Lopez and has the same hourglass figure. She is extremely personable and a local and can give you good pointers on where to go and see in San Diego. If you cannot find the concierge, remember Zulema has the know on where to go. If you visit San Diego and stay at the Westin, you have to experience the 5 star breakfast buffet and meet Kelly, Lindsay, and Zulema. The experience will leave you refreshed, renewed and refueled. If you can not find them,ask for Randy and he willgiveyou theVIP treatment and ensure you are well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was excellent staff were exceptional”
Reviews.Author: nannawollongong
Reviews.Content: We would like to say a special thank you to our Server Juan Verduzco for ecceptional service and for always being friendly and helpful. Juan always had a smile and nothing was too much trouble for him. Congratulations Juan for exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Honesty”
Reviews.Author: Chris_and_Janice
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin on Broadway. During our stay the staff was very friendly and helpful. Jessie was always there morning and night to provide assistance with a smile and our room was very nice and clean. However, when we switched rooms on our second morning I left both my diamond wedding ring and my diamond eternity ring on the night stand next to the clock. Two hours later I realized what I did and went running back to our original room when I noticed it was already cleaned and locked. With complete panic I turned and saw Maria Ramirez who does house keeping on the 21st floor. She asked me what was the matter. After I told her she pulled out my rings and handed them to me. I can't tell you the relief and how pleasantly and utterly surprised I was with her honesty. It is truly rare to find a person like Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: where2next?
Reviews.Content: This was our second successful meeting at the Westin San Diego. The customer service by all of the staff can't be beat!!! As the meeting planner for a well-traveled group of individuals; when attendees come to me saying how great the customer service is and how much they like the hotel, I am thrilled. -Gabe at the bell stand was kind to all of our attendees and even recognized one of the attendees by name at the airport. -Ron and Tom on the banquet staff were always ready to serve and make sure we were taken care of. -Jamie, "the stealthy cleaner" as we nicknamed him, paid attention to small details in cleaning the public areas of the hotel. What a great experience. We wish all hotels had this kind of service. Thank you, Westin San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated, Over Rated, Not up to Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: This hotel, which used to be a Wyndham is not quite up to Westin standards. The carpet was new, but a proper renovation involves more than just carpet. In particular the guest room bathrooms were bland. There was a fridge but no mini bar. Also, no wine glasses in the room. Food at the restaurant was mixed with a disappointing choice of breakfast food menu items. The bar area at the hotel is too small and understaffed to handle a mid-sized conference like ours.

Reviews.Title: “Westin is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTraveling75
Reviews.Content: I love coming to San Diego, and decided to stay at the Westin for the 1st time with freinds, and I could not be more happier with the choice. The location is great and the service was wonderful. Reham Attya gave excellent service, was helpful and gave great recommendations. I will defintly be staying here more often.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beginning and ending that I will repeat with my family and friends”
Reviews.Author: SiSand
Reviews.Content: Something I had wanted to do for so long, a night out in Downtown SD without having to make the drive home to Chula Vista late at night. Check-in was a breeze, the room was beautiful with a great view. We enjoyed our evening out and walked back safely. Enjoyed a restful night in your oh so comfortable beds. Woke up refreshed, had breakfast and drove home feeling I had been a a short sweet vacation. Thank you Westin!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service meets comfort and beauty.”
Reviews.Author: nicolen83
Reviews.Content: Our stay was relaxing and memorable! The hotel was beautiful, clean, the location was perfect, and the service was excellent! Our room service provided by Sergio was friendly and efficient, and the service at the restaurant provided by Kelly and Antonio was exceptional! Kelly and Antonio were both delightful and helpful, and our interactions with them really contributed to the pleasant atmosphere of the hotel and our enjoyment of our trip! A+!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality, Very welcoming, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: bobbienelson
Reviews.Content: Luke Profancik, Front Desk Manager is an excellent representative for The Westin San Diego Hotel. He exceeded our expectations in handling Guests and any problem they may encounter. (Parking Garage Door would not open) He got us to where we needed to be. Reham Attya, Front Desk person registered us. She was very personable. Her conversation with us made us feel very welcome. Jesse was our Bellman and was exceptional in making sure we were very satisfied with his service. The other Bellman were wonderful, too. I can't remember their names. My husband and I have been in the Hotel business for 35 Years. THe Westin San Diego truly knows how to hire a great staff .

Reviews.Title: “Traveling to San Diego? Stay here :)”
Reviews.Author: roufrouf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and was absolutely blown away by the great service- from the front desk agents, the bellmen, the valet guys, the bar servers, room service staff and everybody we encountered are absolutely phenomenal. Our questions are always answered with a smile. The room was very clean and we had a wonderful view of the bay. I could not have ask for a better location as it was a trifecta of everything we needed - close to the airport, the Gaslamp district and also the Convention Center. I would definitely recommend the hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: db374
Reviews.Content: Ok location, easy walk to Gaslamp but lots of homeless in the area. They didnt bother us anyway. It was $32 a night to park with in and out privelidges. I stayed 3 nights but they only charged for 2. Hotel was very clean and nice. Room was spacious. You did hear the trolley, on the 24th floor, but it was few and far between. We chose not to have our room serviced and the housekeeper called to tell us if we needed anything, just to call her. Checkin was 5 minutes flat and checkout was 1 minute. Very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL WEDDING WEEKEND AT THE WESTIN!”
Reviews.Author: AWise515
Reviews.Content: WOW! I work in the hospitality business and have stayed all over, this place is top notch!! The staff bend over backwards to make sure that EVERYTHING, from our amenity delivery, to our host room, to our wedding night stay were just amazing. We started in the rooms side with Jen Cease and Marissa Flon! They were great and easy to work with on any matter. Cynthia & Miranda in room service made sure everything was handled for our "welcome reception". Luke and Bob behind the front desk handled all our requests like pros. We had so many wedding items to store in our room and Van (I think that's his name) was so careful to make sure it all made it there safe and sound! My family has not stopped raving about the VIP stay they received at the Wesin San Diego. I am very pleased that we did our wedding room block with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ScottyP1
Reviews.Content: Very good value, nice rooms. Staff was very helpful. Restaurant staff was especially good. Lindsay our server & Juan Verduzco were terrific. Valet parking was very quick and attentive. Parking is not cheap for valet, but about average for downtowns. Horton Plaza & Gaslamp District are walking distance. Starbucks coffee in the lobby & several other restaurants very close by. Very clean room & super comfortable bed! Enough room for a rollaway & it was a great quality rollaway without the bar poking your back. Great stay..thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip”
Reviews.Author: drmilk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Was kind of worried about the location, but after walking the area I wasn't. It is a bit of a walk to the Gaslamp District (8 blocks). My conference was at the Convention Center on the bay. It's about a mile walk. Just 2 blocks away from the hotel is the MTS Trolley service. It's a 3-5 min ride to the Convention Center, south end of the Gaslamp District, and PETCO Field. The rooms are odd shaped due to the hexagonal shape of the hotel. The beds are "Heavenly Beds" so they were comfortable. My only 2 complaints were paying for internet and thin walls. The walls are very thin and could hear intoxicated business travelers returning from the Gaslamp district. The pool is small, but nice. Valet parking was not cheap (around $28/day), but I'm used to paying $40 in Chicago. Overall, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I decided to take a vacation weekend in...”
Reviews.Author: Shopgirlanne
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a vacation weekend in my own city.... And found the perfect spot! I have seen/driven by the building to many times to count, but it is truely an awesome hotel in a great location. I walked over to Little Italy for dinner and shopped at the mall...both are near.I treated myself to a massage in the hotel...great idea, one of the best lve had...every employee went out of their way to ask if I needed anything and were super friendly and were always smiling I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: donofrano
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here, very quiet rooms and conveinent to Trolley, Gaslamp, Old Town, and the Waterfront. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel in Every Aspect”
Reviews.Author: JRW49
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected for its convenient location and its fine reputation. It is close to the airport, close to downtown attractions, and close to the waterfront. A week-long event was held in one of the hotel's ballrooms. Highlight of this stay - staff members who consistently went the extra mile to support our event. Although the guest rooms are starting to show some age, this facility was spotless, day and night! Especially noteworthy: Paul Lopez, Ray Nicolas, Jose Antonio Selvas Grajales, and Baron. Fitness center was exceptional. Pool was a bit small but on the 3rd floor - very nice! Restaurant was also exceptional. Most of our conference attendees also enjoyed organized events involving golf, indoor go-karts, salt-water fishing and guided tours of San Diego. Again, the staff really made the hotel worth every penny! I would stay at this hotel and/or hold an event at this hotel again in a heart-beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pricey parking, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: MnTLuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference. The hotel location is terrific, and easy to access. My only two complaints from start to finish are the reservation systems and the parking. It would have also been nice to have free internet, especially as a SPG. I initially had my reservation Monday through Friday, and called the hotel the week prior to the stay in order to modify the reservation to depart on Thursday. I had reserved two rooms under my name, and I also added my SPG number to the reservation. When we got to the hotel, they only showed ONE room under my reservation. Unfortunately I had not brought my confirmation email to show the information indicating there were two rooms reserved. The reservation also showed that I was staying through Friday. I informed them that I had contacted the reservation number the week prior in order to change the departure date. All in all, it was not a big issue, as the manager made the appropriate changes, and added the second room. I did call downstairs once I was in the room, in order to request being moved farther from the elevator. They informed me that since I had requested double beds, they were not able to move me. I had not, in fact, requested double beds, but they apparently had a note in the system that someone had talked to me and noted a request for double beds. I informed them that they had not talked with me about the double beds, and I was told that the note must have been put on the wrong reservation. I ended up staying in the initial room for the duration of my stay. The hotel room was very nice, clean and spacious. I had a very nice view of the harbor and the city. The housekeeping was fantastic during my entire stay. Any questions we had were quickly and nice answered by the staff throughout the hotel. The gaslamp district and plenty of restaurants were within walking distance. Parking was steep at $32 per day. It's amazing to me how so many of the hotels charge such high fees for parking your vehicle. There was a parking lot up the street, where parking was $15 for 24 hours with in and out privileges. When we were ready to check out, the front desk informed us that they had us staying through until Friday. I informed them that that had been changed already.....twice. Westin SERIOUSLY needs to re-examne its reservation system! It was ridiculously frustrating. Overall, I would consider staying here again, and park up the street. Next time I stay, I will also bring my email confirmation.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Calderon2
Reviews.Content: The lady Estrella Padilla is a wonderful housekeeper. She's clean, neat, made sure I wanted for nothing (water, towels, soap, coffee). The hotel itself needs better air conditioning (temperature control needs improvement), hot water, hot food (generally delievered luke warm) only a few times when Marina would deliver my food was it ever really HOT. Elevator lights were not properly working ~ even when I spoke to an employee who was waiting for the elevator and I showed them ~ it never got fixed. Front desk managers ~ although at times nice, (was told out of sight out of mine). Windows are dirty, vents are dirty. LOVE the beds (probably the best thing the Westin has to offer). Towels are ruff! When the hotel was full ~ renting a moving or just watching TV ~ WAS A HUGE PROBLEM. Room Service people were always fabulous. I noticed that the front desk people always seemed to have a chip on their shoulders and the help behind the curtains always had a smile on their face and were willing to help. Bellmen ~ fabulous!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but pricey”
Reviews.Author: backintime81
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and modern, although a little small. Beds are super comfortable, desk and flat screen tv are provided. No fridge or microwave. Pool is outdoors. Location is pretty good but you need to take a bus to get to Balboa Park. What I could not swallow the cost of the amenities. Breakfast buffet was $20 a person (fortunately there are options nearby if you don't mind the walk). Internet is $13 a day or $40 for a week. Good grief. I hate being nickeled and dimed after spending so much for a room. I'll be sticking to the lower tier hotels from now on so I get free breakfast and internet, and a mini fridge as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: pardestani
Reviews.Content: In particular, associate Vanessa Diaz made sure that I had all the amenities I needed for my extended stay. She was courteous and I could count on my room being maintained specific to my needs.

Reviews.Title: “solid 5”
Reviews.Author: juliev33
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego for a weekend get away and are so glad we choose the Westin San Diego. They easily earned a solid 5. Our car was valeted, luggage unloaded and we were checked in with in 5 minutes. The girl who checked us in was very welcoming and helpful. We told her we were in town for a relaxing weekend and she suggested their spa services. After getting settled in our room, we followed up about the spa services with the concierge. She booked us a couples massage the next day which we were able to enjoy in the hotel the after laying out by the pool. It was very nice that we didn't have to leave the property for the massage. We paid a few dollars extra for a deluxe room which was well worth the money. The room was large and had a view looking over the bay and Coronado bridge. There were green initiatives displayed in the room which is something I think all hotels should be doing these days. The hotel is located in an ideal location. We were able to walk to all the main attractions we wanted to see; shopping at Seaport Village, dinner in Little Italy and a night cap in the Gaslamp district. Next time we come to San Diego, we will be sure to stay at the Westin San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “A great value and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelgirls07
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my teenage daughter and her friend to San Diego for Spring break and wanted a good deal and decent location considering I was traveling alone with them. We stood at the Westin for two days and it was really nice. The room was really clean and spacious enough for the three of us. The kids loved the pool. The location to the zoo couldn’t have been more convenient. The price of the room was super reasonable and the appetizers at the bar $5.00 each (which I ordered to go and just took up to the room) were good enough for dinner one of the nights and added to our savings. My only word of caution if your watching your budget is the parking which comes in at $24.00 per 24 hour period and isn’t really per night, so you have to watch your trips in and out as the $24.00 per 24 hours can escalate quickly in your bouncing in and out as the clock restarts every time to head out. Other than that the stay was a big hit and the $5.00 cocktail that Mom enjoyed while waiting for the appetizers was as wonderful as the deal. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great location”
Reviews.Author: cazi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin in March of 2010 what a fab hotel great location you could not asked for better if you are staying in San Diego we had a harbour View room the hotel was so quite and I would def stay there again there is a great great coffee house/cafe next door (nothing to do with the hotel which is great for breakfast or a snack)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dpaina
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in late March 2010. Room was well appointed, bed was comfortable. The pool was small but there were several loungers available. The $32 parking was excessive - no need for a car in the area anyways. If you are flying into San Diego, the public transportation is sufficient to get around town. As previously mentioned, there is a big homeless population in downtown San Diego. If you have any experience in big city life, this should be no worry. The walk to the Gas Lamp is 10 minutes...no problem for anyone in shape!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kelann
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, spacious, and oddly shaped! Lots of mirrors and outlets for getting ready. We were able to easily walk to Seaport Village, Gaslamp, Coronado Ferry, and public transportation. Gaslamp was a little further than we thought, but still walkable. Staff was very helpful -- from recommending a bike rental shop to arranging the airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: HoodooGuruFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my spouse when he was traveling for business. His room was paid for at this hotel so this is where we stayed. The hotel was nice and the location is good but it's not worth the price. We've stayed at several hotels over the years and this was the smallest room we have stayed in - an odd triangle shaped room. I also missed the amenities that are included in the price at other hotels, such as internet, free local calls, frig, etc. (I will NOT pay for amenities that should be included, regardless of how much I miss them.) When I arrive in a city I always look through the phone book for ideas of places to visit, unique shops, etc. The room did not have a phone book and when I asked for one at the front desk I was told they did not have any because they prefer guests to use the concierge. How am I supposed to know what I want to see if I don't know what there is to see? The hotel does have a good location. Near several buses to take you to various tourist locations (the zoo, Old San Diego, Coranado Hotel, etc.) Also near the Midway museum and a cruise ship dock. Again a nice hotel but other hotels are just as nice/clean, include amenties and are half the price.

Reviews.Title: “...a full service hotel with fabulous staff and a pet friendly attitude”
Reviews.Author: Kidssleep
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days. Our room was clean, well cared for, and serviced promptly when needed. Breakfast, included with our room charge, was exceptional -- a buffet with the choice of an omelette, if desired. We had dinner one night, and all four choices were excellent. A Starbucks coffee kiosk was open early in the morning, and provided good coffee. Pet friendly, in my opinion, means no additional charge, if there is no service required, and provided there is no damage. This hotel meets the standard. There is a park a short block away for walking the dog, doggie cookies are available, and strokes to friendly dogs are liberally applied. Parking is a downside in this facility, as the hotel offers only Valet Parking at $32 per day.Initially, I accessed the self park option in a parkade across the street, but ultimately opted for the valet option -- the staff were friendly, helpful, and prompt when I needed to access my vehicle. The lack of a charge for my pet and the exceptional breakfast offset, in my opinion, the fee for the parking. I stayed at this facility, as my dog was not accepted at the Kona Kai Resort, where I was attending a meeting. Being a senior was of benefit in establishing the rate I was charged. The rates here are competitive, and the food and service here were of a very high quality. We had our best meal in San Diego in the restaurant at the Westin. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin, what happened?”
Reviews.Author: JohnSFO
Reviews.Content: There was a time when Westin was at the top of their game but there seems to be a slow slide to a lower tier. I booked my room through their site using my Starwoods account/number. I parked my car with valet and received a nice welcome. The person checking me in seemed indifferent to everything - and there were no other guests around so there was little stress. A simple smile probably would have been enough. I passed by the front desk one other time and saw her treating other guests that way so it apparently wasn't personal. But she was clearly sending messages to guests to please stay somewhere else. The room had a city view (you can also book a bay view room). When you walk in to the room you are almost in the bathroom - it's a bid odd. The furnishings are nice, and the bed comfortable. While using the iron it spit out black particles on my shirts because it (likely) had not been maintained or descaled. Fine for a lower tier hotel but surprised me for a Westin. There is free wi-fi but if you want to print your boarding pass it will cost you $6.95 (say what?). There was a cheapish pocket door that separated the sink area from the shower and it was slightly damaged - once again not something I would have expected from the Westin. The valet parking attendants were friendly and efficient - the cost is $33/day; probably not unusual for downtown San Diego. I passed the cleaning staff in the hallway twice and they were pleasant, friendly and welcoming. All in all it's an okay hotel but there are much better choices in downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: bburke25
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. This Westin puts the Westin Gaslamp to shame. The hotel is much more modern and the rooms much cleaner. There's a small cafe called "Emerald Cafe" attached to the hotel that serves an amazing breakfast burrito and has free WiFi. This is my new place to stay when I visit San Diego (4-5 times per year). The location is just a few blocks from the Gaslamp and even closer to the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but lack of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Marber21
Reviews.Content: The Westin located in downtown San Diego is in a great location which is very close to many bars and restaurants. (Don't get confused with the Westin several blocks away located in the Gaslamp district) When we checked in the occupancy was very low which I would've assumed a more personal welcome to the hotel. This wasn't the case. The employees were more concerned about what they had for lunch then giving us a proper checkin. Anyway, besides that the hotel was very clean and modern. Stores were located in the lobby and a 7-11 was conveniently around the corner. Gaslamp district is a little bit of a walk but when you arrive its congested with people eating and drinking. This location is convenient and for the price of 149 wasnt too bad for a few days after Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “incredible service and property”
Reviews.Author: 480quest
Reviews.Content: Excellent attention to detail - great location - the bed linens are fantastic

Reviews.Title: “OMG - Heavenly Beds Rock”
Reviews.Author: SFOAaron
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here, and the place only gets more comfortable. Since converting from that other chain that starts with a "W", this place has gotten luxury at a good price down to an art. Located right in the heart of downtown, and minutes from the airport, just about everything you might want to do in San Diego is in walking distance or a short cab ride. The train station is just around the corner too, making it perfect for a connection from the Coaster or Amtrak. If you don't know about the Heavenly Beds, that alone is reason to stay here. Doesn't get any more comfortable. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, great hotel with vast amenities and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: VivaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My 6 year old daughter wanted to experience room service as she had heard about it on TV and in a movie. So, on her 6th birthday I took her and two of her 5 year old girlfriends to this hotel for a night of room service, a movie and some swimming. The girls and I had a blast. The hotel was beautiful, quiet and comfortable. The staff were so kind to the three little girls as they checked in and ordered room service (with a little help). The pool was beautiful and the lounge chairs and towels were always plentiful. The emerald artwork, while on the many escalators and while traveling in the glass elevators, was a delight to look at. The girls and I did not want to leave. I even received compliments from the mothers when I brought the girls home about how great the girls smelled (from the bath products they had used from the hotel). It was a perfect trip and we plan to make it a birthday tradition as do the other little girls. I highly recommend this hotel and would not have changed a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Stay”
Reviews.Author: hotelhoppa76
Reviews.Content: Westin's slogan 's that include, heavenly, elevate your senses, and unwind are all true to their accommodations and feel. From the "heavenly" dual shower head shower to the clean, soft, and fluffy linens. Your arrival to the valet and the front desk is friendly and welcoming and our housekeeping service was timely and efficent each day. Each morning the staff rolls out a huge table of goodies and refreshments for snacking on for the guests. This was a nice touch. Amenities in the bathroom are also very nice and "sensory" oriented to include white tea shampoo, soaps, and lotions. Rooms were very spacious and had great view of the city. Close to everything in San Diego. This hotel offers the perfect service, location, and amenities! Oh yes and they are pet friendly!

Reviews.Title: “A fun and beautiful adventure in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: drhog
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked near the hotel, we were greeted from the bell hops, to the front desk, to the waiters, etc... The views of the mountains, the San Diego Bay and downtown were outrageous.Thank you for the hospitality, Dr.David:)

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 night in late November at the rate of £100 per night (~$165) booked through hotels.com. Chose the hotel as it was the convention hotel. It was a good experience. It's in a good location. It's a nice decent hotel. There is plenty of local (expensive) parking. I didn't really use hotel facilities other than the gym which was fine with some decent equipment (2 x-trainers, couple of joggers, and couple of bikes in one room and free weights and space in an adjacent room). Internet was $12.95 +tax per night - didn't use it as I now have mobile broadband. Would be happy to return and probably will!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JackandMaddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on business and had a pleasant experience overall. I was grateful for the free shuttle to and from the airport. This hotel is in a great location, downtown, within walking distance to the Gaslamp, Horton Plaza, etc. The Coffee Bean is just a block away. I had a beautiful view of the bay and the Coronado bridge. The rooms were quiet, clean, and very nice. I really enjoyed the bed and the starbucks coffee in the room! There was also a fridge. The HD TV was a definite plus! This hotel is classy and sophisticated without going over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBeeMel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this Westin two or three times- most recently in October 2009. I have to say that this hotel keeps getting better and better. The lobby is spacious and modern, and the rooms are comfortable and inviting. One of my favorite touches was water, flavored with fresh-cut fruit, in the lobby. Rooms: The beds are ultra-comfy and luxurious, the TV’s are flat screen, and every possible amenity is at your fingertips. The views of the harbor and the sweeping downtown skyline are simply gorgeous. The rooms are so nice that it almost makes it hard to leave, but of course San Diego is such an amazing city that you just have to get out and explore. Location: The location can’t be beat. The Westin is only steps from Horton Plaza, Little Italy, Downtown, Seaport Village, and the Embarcadero. Petco Park is only a few blocks away. Walk to the Embarcadero and hop on a ferry to Coronado. Stay here if you want to be close to everything that downtown San Diego has to offer- restaurants, shopping, nightlife, etc. Service: We received excellent service from the front desk staff and especially from the free shuttle service. We needed transportation to several appointments and a wedding, and the shuttle drivers were more than accommodating in helping us and our friends get to where we needed to be. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone making a visit to downtown San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “A dream stay”
Reviews.Author: heidi056
Reviews.Content: The experience was perfect relaxation,comfort and service. I have traveled a lot and stay in 4 star hotels and this was by far the best experience I've ever had. Heidi Wilson NY State

Reviews.Title: “Beware booking a reservation at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EarlYoder
Reviews.Content: Confirmed reservations secured with a CC mean nothing here. Arrived in town for convention and when to hotel at 3:00 pm to check in , and they did not have a room for me, in spite of the fact we had booked our reservations 4 months in advance. Apparently some large company came in and booked a bunch of rooms, so they had no room available for me. And they really didn't even seem to feel bad about it. Just matter of factly insisted they had no room there, but could put me up at the Sheraton (all Starwood hotels) by the airport, which was by the airport and close to convention center. The only good news is I was able to get a room at the Omni at the last minute for about the same price and it was a much nicer hotel and next door to the convention center. So beware booking reservation with Starwood hotels -- they think of only themselves and not the traveler. E. Yoder

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Gas Lamp District”
Reviews.Author: KaylynnE
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great area, with tons of shopping and dining. Walking distance to convention center and Padres stadium, and 10 car ride to zoo and airport. The rooms were a bit outdated, but we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: empresz
Reviews.Content: My group stayed here only one night because of the Liver Walk at the SD Zoo the following morning. But this is the second year we chose this particular Westin. They never disappoint and meet all my needs. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean and the facility itself is maintained well. It's not too far from the busier areas of SD, but far enough that the noise doesn't bother me. So if I do the Liver Walk again next year, I will most likely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: trippin76
Reviews.Content: After a great experience at a Westin in Scottsdale my boyfriend and I decided to try the Westin San Diego for a weekend getaway. We could not have been happier with our stay. We booked a king room, city view but were upgraded to an ocean view. We were on the 15th floor and had a great view. The room was shaped a little weird due to the design of the building but it was comfortable and very manageable. The room was very clean, the bed is amazingly comfortable and the bathroom was clean and well stocked. The fruit flavored water in the lobby was a fun touch as well. The staff was friendly and I loved the fact that there was a free airport shuttle. It made getting to the hotel and back very easy. The hotel s in a great central location. Walking distance to the Gaslamp, Little Italy, the mall and it's right next to the bus and trolley routes. My only complaint would be that the pool was VERY small. We had planned on having some time hanging out at the pool but after seeing how small it was we didn't, which was fine, there is plenty to do in San Diego. I would stay here again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Samhtb
Reviews.Content: We attended a wedding and reception at the hotel. Room was very nice. The wedding recepection was outstanding. Cocktail hour was great all the employees were very courteous. The best of all was when we walked into the recepection room the decorations and table settings were so beautiful. Service was excellent. We will certainly recommend this hotel to our family and fridens.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CatGirl22
Reviews.Content: As locals, we have been to downtown San Diego many times. This was our second stay at this Westin, and it gets a total recommendation. Yes, at night there are homeless people in downtown. It's a sad fact of life for now. However, even though we walked all around late at night, none of them bothered us. This hotel is in a wonderful locaion for getting to either the more tourist area of Horton Plaza, or the great neighborhood of Little Italy. Despite the fact that our room was almost free because of Starwood Points, we still were given an amazing room on the twentieth floor with great views to Balboa Park on the horizon. We only stayed one night, but the room was clean, quiet, and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be Returning”
Reviews.Author: susanandmo
Reviews.Content: We won't be returning to this Westin. It's was not worth what we paid for. To our standards the hotel is below average. The rooms are very small, parking is super expensive and their is lots of construction in the area, so it wasn't a peaceful sleep at night (even though the beds are very comfortable. It's about a one mile + walk to Gaslamp Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Only the natural flavored waters were worth the stay...”
Reviews.Author: gsmack
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. Clean, but no good views. We were supposed to have ocean view but had construction view...beds: comfortable...s howers: horrible! Noise pipes, no water pressure. Did not like the fact that their toiletries are supposed to be natural/hypoallergenic and they are really not. I broke out in hives after using their soap. A very expensive hotel, expensive food (not worth it)...location: Bit far from the Gas Lamp Quarter...a bit of a walk to little Italy (loved Bon Appetito Retaurante...authentic Italian cusine) and far walk to the conference center. The only thing worth going back is the free naturally flavored waters set at the side entrance of the hotel. Flavors change every day ...melon, orange, pineapple and lemon...delicious and refreshing on hot days...A water treat!

Reviews.Title: “It's an awesome hotel, expect the best because you'll get the best”
Reviews.Author: Little09traveler
Reviews.Content: The Westin San Diego is a very clean and quiet hotel. It is located in downtown of San Diego near shopping mall, a lot of restaurants, San Diego Bay and it is also near San Diego Zoo or Mission Beach. Employees are knowledgeable and very kind people who are going above and beyond to help you enjoy your stay. Rooms are beautiful and clean with light scent of white tea. The Westin's heavenly bed lives up to its name! Hotel has great workout and swimming pool area as well as nice bar and restaurant. I would recommend The Westin San Diego hotel because it is amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of the old Wyndham left all over the place.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: Updated rooms, stunning lobby and entrance. Infused fruit and water stations in the lobby are a classy addition. The bathrooms are pretty nasty and not updated from the old prior hotel and the ceilings in th rooms are old and mildewy. Pool is small but gym rocks and towels are plenty. The walk back at night is a little sketchy. DONT PARK IN THE HOTEL, THERE IS A PARKING LOT ACROSS THE LOBBY FOR HALF OFF.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: LATRVLR25
Reviews.Content: Bought package from 3rd party site. Did not get the requested King bed (too booked), got a small room, fresh, well-maintained. No elegance, luxury. Locale requires 5-7block walk to dinner, past homeless and pavement campers. Recommend hotels to the south of GasLamp quarter. Concierge's tout for dinner was mediocre. Had decent well-maintained Fitness Center, pool area. Restaurant poorly supervised. Parking $36 daily, in/out. Good HappyHour

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Staff”
Reviews.Author: FARMER1870
Reviews.Content: I attended my nephew's wedding at the hotel. The hotel was very accommodating, when my nephew had to move the wedding indoors a couple of days prior, due to anticipated hot weather. The hotel made the arrangements to move it indoors without hesitation. They wanted my nephew's wedding to meet all his expectations and it did. We had Hors d'œuvre's served along with champagne or sparkling cider prior to the dinner. The staff serving us were very attentive. The ballroom where the wedding reception was held was set up so beautifully and the staff serving dinner were very attentive as well and bent over backwards with my need for extra bread, butter, water, coffee etc.... I actually felt so bad for asking for so much and I told them so, but the servers smiled and stated, " they were happy to be of service". I have a big family and I caught myself stacking dishes to help the server out of habit and they kindly stated, you are here to relax, let us take care of you". This statement made me feel special and pampered. We spent the night at the hotel. The room was beautiful, clean, quiet, comfortable and cozy, but also roomy. We had a nice view of Downtown San Diego from our room. If and when I visit San Diego in the future, this is the hotel I would plan to stay at. Great Job Westin!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Grinnders
Reviews.Content: Stayed in San Diego for a week whilst attending a conference. This hotel was on the organiser's recommended list and was one of the nearest priced to a government allowance. We noted it was NOT in the gaslamp quarter, but a colleague with previous knowledge of the area knew the proximity and it was only a short walk to the gaslamp district. This frequently involved passing vagrants but none of them ever verbally asked for money or harrassed us, I guess because verbally requesting money is either illegal or tantamount to admitting vagrancy which may be illegal in the US. Written signs were the most prominent form of request. This is not to detract from the hotel but explain the location and the experience of going to and fro the gaslamp quarter. On arrival at the hotel check in was swift and efficient. As a diabetic I enquired whether there was a refrigerator in my room to preserve my insulin supplies. Unfortuantely this was not standard in my room but the guy at reception promised to see if any were available. Within 30 minutes a porter brought one up and plugged it in. Job done. Thank you. The rooms are oddly shaped due to the buildings octagonal construction, so consequently you cannot complain that they are typically box shaped, well not quite anyway. The room was clean and well presented with coffee machine (Starbucks normal and decaff) plus a selection of teas. Note for Brits: Bring your own tea.. there is probably only one tea of "traditional" blend. Although well stocked the pots of milk are "half and half" which is okay for coffee... not so good for traditional tea, still I got by by using 1 pot only. Supplies are replenished daily. There is a large flat screen TV as promised with many claimed "HD" channels, although I think that is mainly hype as most of the broadcast material is definitely SD. I didn't try the movie service but would imagine they shoudl be proper HD versions. I tried to connect my laptop to the TV and stream videos instead however I had only brought a VGA cable and even if the TV had a VGA port, there was no acccess with a screwed on back plate and cover. However, on one side the TV did have a mini-DIN pin input + Red + White + Yellow... plus a few others so if you have cabling for those S-VHS style inputs I suspect you could be more successful than me. No free WiFi access, but wired and WiFi available in the room at a charge. I used it to Skype video conference back home to my wife. It worked brilliantly the first day (Sunday) but only partially for the others. Whether this was my home PC/home bandwidth or that the hotel WiFi is a shared service and hence there may be more competition on the week days, reducing my percentage of shared access to the internet I could not prove. The bed was very comfortable with plenty of pillows and clean cotton linen. The air conditioning was effective and very quiet... I like to sleep cool so this was very beneficial. I did hear the rumbling of trams as mentioned by other patrons (presumably up to about midnight) however whether it was the effect of a modicum of alcohol consumption or pure jet-lag tiredness they didn't disrupt my sleep. The bathroom was clean and tidy and well managed with fresh dry towels when required. The double headed shower was very effective although I needed to ignore the wall plate which suggested turning clockwise to get hotter, when in fact my shower was anti-clockwise... perhaps the inlet pipes were switched on original installation? I used the free gym everyday usually 0630-0730. It is small gym for a hotel of this size but very well laid out in two sections. 1 full of aerobic machinery (Mainly LifeCycle/LifeStyle brand).... 2 x cross trainers, 2 x bikes (1 upright/1 sitdown) and about 4 running machines, sadly no rower. Some had the more modern touch screen LCDs (with integrated TVs or virtualised hill climbs) others are the more traditional red LED readouts. Of the 4 machines I used they were all in good operating order, although toe straps for the bikes would have been nice, but guess that's another nanny state health and safety risk! FYI, when I was there, maximum occupancy was probably 4-5 people. The 2nd section is more of an aerobics studio with free weights in the corner and Aerobic balls, the rest of the area is open and ideal for stretching. with floor to ceiling, wall to wall mirrors. There are a limitless supply of towels in both rooms and a water cooler in the nearby corridor. Both rooms have a view onto the pool and jacuzzi. I didn't use either. The pool is really very small and no good for serious swimmers (which I am not anyway) and more than 3 people trying to do lengths would be it, but it's nice and well kept as I spotted the staff checking the chlorine levels 3 times in the week I was there. Sadly when I may have wished to use it, later afternoon/early evening, the sun had been eclipsed behind neighbouring tower blocks... so perhaps best to use it up to and including lunch for a "dip" only. We didn't use the restaurant(s) at all but preferred to take breakfast via the onsite Starbucks franchise where you could get coffee (obviously) but also juice, cereals, pastries, muffins, granola bars etc, certainly enough for a modest every-day breakfast We used the hotel shuttle (FREE) bus to take us back to the airport (it's only about 10 minutes) but make sure you get dropped at the right terminal. Although we were flying back to the UK we were taking a domestic flight to LAX first and not a direct International one. The two terminals are actually quite a distance apart and involve getting on a shuttle bus... also if you've self-serviced and checked in mistakenly at the Intl. terminal but are then informed you have to board at another.. having suitcases tagged but in your posession between two terminals is quite disturbing to the check in staff at teh domestic desks. LOL In summary I'd say this is a good value for money hotel in a pretty reasonable location and if you can manage to save a few bucks and maximise use of the facilities it's probably a relative bargain. Why pay extra for what you may not use?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: PLRamirez
Reviews.Content: This is a good "Business hotel". You are walking distance to the Gaslamp district and the area attractions. The rooms are a bit dated but an overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations or of a Westin/ Starwood experience”
Reviews.Author: fkrieger
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation via spg.com (platinum member) and stayed at this hotel last weekend. Long story short- the service was pretty slow. Although the staff were nice people (as all San Diegeans I think are)... they are pretty forgetful and not too quick on their feet. Evidence: 1) Called after making my reservation online to reserve a crib... was put on hold and nobody ever came back. I called back and reserved a crib via a 2nd call. 2) When I arrived at the hotel there was no crib in the room.. even AFTER calling back a second time to confirm (or really a third call overall after the debacle in my first point). UGG! So we had a crying 1 year old at 10pm waiting for a crib (which took 40 mins to come up after I called down to the front desk twice). 3) I asked for two rooms next to each other... but they were not connected. This is just somewhat annoying, not THAT big a deal, but when you mention on the phone that you have a family and would like two rooms together... it'd be nice to have the front desk put 2 + 2 together. 4) Finally... on Sunday I called down to see if I could get a late checkout... and again got put on hold and the person never returned!?!?! To their credit, they did call back 15 mins later to apologize (after I sat on the phone for 10 mins just waiting for them to give me a "yes" or a "no").

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect..a beautiful and delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsm85
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin in San Diego for the past two years and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. I went to San Diego for a relaxing getaway from reality and the Westin gave me what I wanted; beautiful rooms with such elegance, breathtaking lobby, great staff, amazing "heavenly" bed, and it's in the center of the city. It's just such a great location AND a FREE shuttle from the airport that picked us up! The rooms are really roomy and peaceful. By the end of my trip, I wanted to take the heavenly bed with me; it is just super comfortable. The bath soaps and fragrances are relaxing and helped me unwind. I am even looking to buy some online - I just love the smell! The staff were also very friendly and helpful. The minute we walked in they were ready to help and assist. Anytime we asked for extra coffee or towels they were at our door in less than 5 minutes. I've never experienced such attentiveness. I would rate the Westin one of the best - cream of the crop.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, plush and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TexasSharvi
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious, clean and the beds are VERY comfortable. Starbucks coffee in the room. Fitness room is very nice. Good location, walking distance to just about everything. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: y_susan
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in San Diego for business. The hotel and the service was great. I liked the room --got the one with 1 king bed. The location was strategic at downtown San Diego. I could easily walk to many restaurants and only 4-5 blocks from a shopping mall. I got a room with city view and it was a bit noisy during night hours since there was a construction across the street (and apparently the workers worked until around 2 am in the morning) Other than that... my first visit was great.

Reviews.Title: “awesome beds”
Reviews.Author: bluehawaii2003HD
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at the westin gas lamp. This hotel was open and I have to say that even though it wasn't on the gas lamp it's a great hotel. The staff is awesome and the rooms were great

Reviews.Title: “I WOULD NOT go back here”
Reviews.Author: TiaLiL
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel from Priceline for a girls Memorial day weekend and I thought since it was the "Westin" and it was a 4 star hotel, what could go wrong? We got to the hotel at 5pm and couldn't check in until 6 because they said our room wasn't ready so they asked if we wanted a map or a few drinks...duh! We took the drinks and the map. So they call me when the room is ready and we don't have a refrigerator or a microwave! We called the operator to ask for a refrigerator and they said they were all taken. If they hadn't made us wait until 6pm to check in, I wouldn't have had a problem with that, but since they were all taken and we had to check in at 6pm, I was very upset, but sitll didn't complain. The parking situation is horrendous! To valet it's $32 a day or you can self park for $24 a day. There are a few parking spots with meters, but good luck. Your best bet is to park your car in the lot behind the hotel (the street parallel to braodway) for $17 a day and take a taxi or walk where you need to go (It's $5 a day on the weekends and holidays). Needless to say we did that and never paid for valet or self park. After finding out the parking siutation, I complained to the manager, Jen, and she apologized and gave us breakfast tickets worth $45 a day for the two mornings we were going to be there. The food was WONDERFUL. I would pay for it if we didn't have the tickets. She also told me they would put us on the list for the next refrigerator and see what she could do about parking. After we got our free tickets, we never heard from her and never got a refrigerator. So this morning, I look at my account online, and they charged me $32 for valet when we never used it! I called and the receptionist said she'd take it off but it would take 10-12 business days! This hotel should not be a 4 star hotel. They have too many issues and when you're trying to get away and have a nice vacation, the hassle isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: doktar
Reviews.Content: Generally, Westin is a good bet. This particular Westin has friendly, attentive, responsive service, clean rooms, great food and hospitality. I recommend it heartily!

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveller24
Reviews.Content: fabulous location - walking distance to Horton Plaza, the train station and many other wonderful places. the staff were so friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelating
Reviews.Content: Beginning with the free shuttle from the airport this hotel has great service, spotless facilities, and a bright and welcoming staff. I rode in with two airline pilots on a turnaround from Chicago - no strangers to travel - who said this is "a good one." They were right. The Westin provided all the right things that even the best hotels might slip or miss one way or the other - towels, safe, hot water, bedding. Nothing was broken or dirty and the staff couldn't be nicer or more helpful. The location is excellent for downtown access. It's a nice walk to the convention center and the tram is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience & they felt me feel welcome from check in to checkout”
Reviews.Author: JohnCHotel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel stay was excellent. We ate at the restaurant at night & the food was verfy good. I had the Steak which was warm during my entire meal - served on a hot metal plate (with wood on outside). And ambiance was quiet & elegant. The room service was very professional & courteous & appeared to care when they asked if I needed anything else or if I enjoyed my stay (which I did).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, convienient and helpful hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: cindymchristman
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights with two young children. They loved the heated pool and hot tub. The rooms were very spacious and very clean! Every employee of the hotel was very helpful and very friendly. They advised us of restaurants and sites with directions. They spent time with us to make sure that we were happy and satisfied. I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for a downtown getaway”
Reviews.Author: MyConcierge
Reviews.Content: Renovated hotel, nice Westin standards, very clean. Our room had a great city view and you could see the bay too (fun just to sit and watch the activity all around). Small pool and fitness center is very attractive and nice to use. We ate room service, good staff and portions are pretty big. Location is easy walk to clubs and restaurants, museum of contempory art & waterfront. Would recommend for little getaway (like us) or business if you needed a downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious room, with customer service that was above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: aks_va
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for 3 nights in April 2009, while in San Diego for a conference. I was fortunate to obtain a (still expensive) discounted rate and free internet access through my conference. Free airport shuttle, convenient location near the Gaslamp Quarter, the conference center and Little Italy. My room was beautifully appointed, with the famous Westin bed, an enormous bathroom, and a luxurious bathrobe. The hotel has a fantastic gym that is open 24 hrs./day, and I was quite impressed by the friendliness of the staff members. Two mornings, for example, the shuttle bus driver was nice enough to drive me to the conference center (a pleasant 15-min. walk away, but problematic when in heels and/or carrying luggage). I would highly recommend this hotel -- I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “the best wedding every”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCitySasha
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very nice the poeple the hotel itself is nice i would come back and bring friends too .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful structure, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: nwms1999
Reviews.Content: Went to the Westin San Diego for a wedding. It is conveniently located minutes from downtown and Lindberg Intl Airport. The ocean can be seen from the outdoor rooftop pool. The building was gorgeous and has a definite air of quality. The food and the servers were impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely an amazing place for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: cdhsaved
Reviews.Content: Great location and access to public transportation, restaurants, entertainment, shopping sightseeing and freeways. The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable; slept like a baby! The food was very advertising and delicious. The check in and check out were fast and smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: nbologne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin San Diego in August 2007 for a week. The room was great - clean, modern, extremely comfortable bed. I thought the location was good as well - walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and the convention centre. Had room service one night for dinner and it was excellent. The fitness centre was great. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel in San Diego I will stay”
Reviews.Author: ProjectManager42
Reviews.Content: If you have the pleasure of going to San Diego - you have to stay at the Westin San Diego. Not only is the location central to everything (Gaslamp, Harbor, Seaport Village, and Little Italy) but it is pet friendly. The area around the hotel is clean and it doesn't seem to have nearly as many homeless people around, as the ones closer to the Gaslamp area. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and they treat me and my dogs like we are VIP's. The hotel has a great feel to it and the rooms are very clean. #1 place to stay in SD in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “If there isn't anywhere else then this is ok.”
Reviews.Author: a_lee_nyc
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this place got better reviews than the Gaslamp Westin. The Gaslamp Westin is in a better location and I can't imagine that it's any worse than this Westin. This is not Westin quality. It's more like a Holiday Inn. Just remember that and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid hotel - just not an impressive one.”
Reviews.Author: jasper87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is solid - they provide the basics just as they should. However, its just missing that "wow" factor to make it an impressive one. The rooms were clean, maid service was timely and everything in my room was functional. The staff, while efficient, just didn't have that "pop" to make it a great property. While they weren't rude, it felt like they were just going through the motions to provide check-in/check-out service to us. We called for an airport shuttle and were told it would take 20 minutes. It took 40. We arrive and the desk clerk checked us in, but it took 15 minutes for two rooms. The only noticeable exception - the conceriege when he was at his post. He knew the area extremely well and guided us to perfect restaurants and shopping. However, we tried to visit him six times - only two times was he at his post. Overall, a solid, well-functioning hotel. Just not one that will stand out in our minds.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: AATBenjamin
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a bad Westin, it just wasn't a great Westin. The lobby was kind of funky. It felt like an office building more than a Starwood hotel. The room was comfotable, but the shape was a little odd. The bar/restaurant downstairs was also a bit strange. I went down for a drink and a late dinner and was the only one there. Me and the bartender watching sportscenter. The location would be good if you wanted to spend time downtown, venture into the gaslamp district or just be near the airport. Not great if you're going to SD for some beach time. Again it there wasn't anything about it that was bad. It just didn't wow me.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I would go back...”
Reviews.Author: Pemaca
Reviews.Content: I cannot decide if I liked the hotel or not. It definitely is clean and the service was what I expected. But here is a list of my issues. 1. Booked a room with two double beds and requested a rollaway which was printed on my confirmation. Upgraded for $25 to bayview. At check in was told that rollaways were not permitted due to fire codes. Impossible for me and two teen boys to fit in the room we were given. Even though it was an upgrade, the room was so small, you could not walk around the beds, there was no door to the bathroom that you could close, only a pocket door that did not close. Windows were covered up in places with yellow tape, as if they were broken. Upon seeing the size of the room and the unavailability of the rollaway, I had to book another room. Funny thing is - in booking the new room - I got the cheapest room available at the time and it was much larger and nicer than the original room I booked (so my issue with the hotel, is what is the point of an upgraded room, what exactly did my upgrade pay for)...! By the way the cheaper room also had a bayview. Another point of contention, my friends stayed in a lower rate room and not only had more space, a bayview and a real bathroom door, but also received bathrobes, which I did not get). My suggestion is do not get the upgrade!! Another point of contention is the location. I think it is convenient in the sense that you can walk to just about anywhere you need to go, but I would not feel comfortable at night in that area, definitely as a woman with kids felt like I had to be hyper aware. I am used to the homeless, living and working in Boston, but the hotel seems to be in a very active homeless area. There is a lot of people asking for money, so just know this if you are going to stay here. I did like the pool and hot tub, but other than that, I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jcdjcdcVancouver
Reviews.Content: Westin Downtown San Diego was a 4 - 5 Star Experience. To begin, the driver of the Hotel Shuttle Bus from the airport to the hotel offered us ice cold water while he handled our luggage. Upon arriving at the Hotel front desk, the lady processing us was polite, courteous and very helpful at checking us in. Our room was nicely appointed, and the king size bed was as comfortable as the one in our own home. Hotel noise from other rooms and in the halls was zero. The Westin is an easy walk to Horton Shopping Centre, Gaslight District. Public transportation is close to the hotel. The hotel restaurant is a little pricey for dinner and breakfast - but there are restaurants in the area that are reasonably priced if you don't want to dine at the hotel. A quick breakfast can be had in the deli out front of the hotel. When it was time to leave for our cruise the Shuttle bus drove us to the drop off zone at the Cruise Ship. Would stay again at the Westin

Reviews.Title: “loved it...don't know why anyone would complain...”
Reviews.Author: freckles101
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel with my boyfriend, and as soon as i walked in i was stunned...the lobby was beautiful and the elavators were glass and see threw. I loved the outside pool which was on the 3rd floor and loved the view of the beauiful downtown San Diego. The place was very clean and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne4_8
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews we stayed at The Westin for 4 nights in September. We were picked up from the airport by the free shuttle, which was very convenient. Check in was smooth and I did ask for a large rom, however the girl insisted all room sizes were the same. I am not sure if they are or not but it didn't really matter as we were there to sightsee and wouldn't be spending a huge amount of time in the rooms. We had a couple of problems with the safe and a problem in the bathroom, but these were resolved promptly. The beds were comfy but the decor was quite dated. I noticed that the powerpoints in the hallway were falling off ,which isn't ideal if you have small children around. Everyone raves about the shower, but I couldn't really see what all the fuss is about. It was an average bathroom. One strange thing was that housekeeping kept leaving clean towels but never took the dirty ones. By the end of the stay we had quite a collection of towels!! The hotel was centrally located to the train depot, the wharf and within walking distance to Little Italy. Wehad no problems getting around without a car which was why we chose a central location. There seemed to be quite a few homeless people around the hotel. There were more homeless people than I anticipated. I was usually with a group when walking back to the hotel from dinner so didn't feel afraid. However, on one occasion when I had to walk back to the hotel alone someone tried to follow me. I did feel a little threatened as it was quite a few blocks to walk from the main shopping area and not alot of places to get help if needed. The Westin was pricey for what it offered although I did get a reasonable deal from Expedia. Would I choose this hotel again. Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: ElyseAshton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin San Diego for three days to attend the San Diego film festival. The location was great and we could easily walk to all the venues. The train depot is nearby and the highway entrance/exit is less than a mile away so it makes getting around the San Diego area very simple. The hotel itself was very clean, felt freshly decorated and comfortable. The room was spacious and everything worked properly. The bed is enormous and we slept very well. There were two 'comfy chairs" of different styles. We got some noise from the train depot and the ships coming into the harbor, but nothing to inhibit rest. The staff anticipated us running out of shampoo, etc, and left more when they saw we were running low. On my birthday, I came back to the room to find they had set my birthday card from my husband( --which I had just opened that morning )on the bed and surrounded it with chocolates! We attended parties for the festival at different venues and met up with groups staying at the nearby W hotel, and both my husband and I agreed we preferred the Westin for comfort and serenity . Our room overlooked the bay and we could watch the sailboats and cruise ships come in. It is well worth a little extra to us to get that sort of water view. All the employees from the front desk to the valets, housekeeping and restaurant staff, were friendly and helpful. Every single one. They gave us directions and answered questions. No attitude or rush. What a refreshing change after a recent stay at a factory-feeling hotel in Vegas! The breakfast buffet at the restaurant is a little expensive ($18--for me who usually stumbles around at home in the morning with tea and toast) but has a great selection of fruits, yogurts, breads and hot dishes. You can also order a la carte off the menu and there is a coffee shop in the lobby so you can just grab a quick bite. My only caveat would be that despite the convenience of the location, some people might not enjoy the area as there are many homeless who may approach--and did ---even just inside the hotel doors one evening. There is a Greyhound bus station a couple of blocks away and the people you meet on your walks can seem a bit dodgey. I'm from LA and used to that, but I know my family from Wisconsin would be uncomfortable. Area parking is also expensive but worth it to keep one's car safely indoors under guard. Again, coming from LA I find it is a false economy not to pay for parking in a downtown area. We had a lovely time at the Westin and could easily recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at This Westin”
Reviews.Author: ACJ12345
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in San Diego and had to choose from all of the downtown hotels. I always love Westin, but I was torn, since there are 2 Westins in downtown, this on and Gaslamp. I, of course, read the reviews on TripAdvisor and choose this one. I was not disappointed! The hotel was great. Wonderful, helpful staff. Clean rooms, great location. My friend stayed at the Westin Gaslamp, and she wished she had picked my hotel. Gaslamp was more outdated, and not as spacious. Hands down a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little bland”
Reviews.Author: Onmessage1
Reviews.Content: You know what? Westin did the best it could with this one. The Westin San Diego shares its lobby with an office complex, Emerald Plaza, and it's hard to see where one starts and one stops. (As a result, you sometimes feel like you're standing in an office rather than a hotel lobby.) That said, the rooms have been freshly redecorated and are nice in that Westin monochromatic way. The beds, of course, are great as is the shower! There is also a fantastic fitness facility and lap pool. The hotel location has its plusses and minusses. On the plus side, it's close to little Italy, the waterfront and to Horton Plaza. In addition, you don't hear the trains much at all, which is a real issue downtown. On the minus side, the hotel is directly across the street from the YMCA and there always seemed to be quite a few homeless out in front.

Reviews.Title: “Will Try Somthing Different Next Time”
Reviews.Author: EverettDickens
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in June 2008. Staying here again would certainly not be the worst thing, there are definately some niceties, but the little things started to add up enough that next time we go to San Diego we will very likely try another hotel as this Westin did not "sell us." The good: 1) We asked for a high floor and received a room on the 20th floor. 2) Great view of the water and sunset. 3) Great shower. 4) Convenient location (close to a brewery; Gaslamp Quarter; Petco Park; WAMU ATM; bagel shop; Seaport Village etc.). 5) Staff was very friendly, helpful and accessible (but not always successful). The not-so-good: 1) The air conditioning either didn't work the first night or has such a high setting of temperature to be useless.
